headline: Tata Motors PV reports net loss of Rs 3,486 crore in Q3 as JLR cyber hit weighs
condensed_text:
Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles (Tata Motors PV) on Thursday reported a consolidated net loss of Rs 3,486 crore in Q3 FY26, impacted by the cyber incident at its luxury arm Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), which severely hampered global wholesale volumes. The consolidated revenue from operations for the quarter stood at Rs 70,108 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025 a decline of 25.8 per cent compared to Rs 94,472 crore in the corresponding period last year. Consolidated Q3 financials at a glance:
The EBITDA plummeted to Rs 1,518 crore from Rs 12,663 crore in the year-ago period, consequently, the EBITDA margin shrank to 2.2 per cent against 13.4 per cent in Q3 FY25. Jaguar Land Rover revenue came in at £4.5 billion, down 39.4 per cent year-on-year, with EBITDA margins slipping to 0.7 per cent. Shailesh Chandra, Managing Director & CEO, Tata Motors PV, said, "In Q3 FY26, we recorded our highest-ever quarterly wholesales at 171k units... driven by strong demand tailwinds from GST 2.0 and a robust festive season".

headline: IndiGo shares fall on CCI probe trigger; here's what analysts advise
condensed_text: "This is to inform that the Competition Commission of India (CCI) has issued a prima facie order dated February 4, 2026, under Section 26(1) of the Competition Act, 2002 (Act), directing the CCI’s Director General (DG) to initiate an investigation against the Company (Order). On the earnings front, the country's largest airline reported a sharp 77.6 per cent year-on-year (YoY) decline in net profit at Rs 549.1 crore for the December 2025 quarter (Q3 FY26). "One should hold on to the IndiGo stock and consider fresh buying on dips with a medium- to long-term view," said Kranthi Bathini, Equity Strategist at WealthMills Securities. On levels front, Rs 4,700–4,550 is anticipated to provide cushion to the counter, and a sustained move beyond Rs 5,000 is likely to trigger fresh longs in the counter in the near period," said Osho Krishan, Senior Analyst – Technical & Derivative Research at Angel One. He added that a decisive move above Rs 4,800 could push the stock towards Rs 5,200, with the expected short-term trading range pegged between Rs 4,600 and Rs 5,200.

headline: Bharti Airtel Q3 earnings: Net profit at Rs 6,630 crore, revenue rises 19%
condensed_text: Consolidated net profit fell 2.3% to Rs 6630.5 crore in the last quarter against Rs 6791.7 crore in the December 2024 quarter. Revenue rose 19.6% to Rs 53,982 crore in Q3 against Rs 45,129 crore revenue in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal, led by continued growth in India and solid performance in Africa. India business reported quarterly revenues of Rs 39,226 crore, growing 13.2% YoY and 1.4% QoQ. During the quarter, Bharti Airtel entered into a strategic partnership with Google to set up India’s first Artificial Intelligence (AI) hub in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. This landmark initiative will accelerate the adoption of AI across India, strengthen the country’s digital backbone and bring Google’s full AI-stack and consumer services closer to Indian businesses.

headline: ICICI Bank share at Rs 1,750? Key overhang removed, stock a top banking buy, says MOFSL
condensed_text: Motilal Oswal Financial Services (MOFSL) on Thursday said ICICI Bank Ltd was its top pick in the banking sector, saying the board’s recommendation to extend Sandeep Bakhshi’s tenure as Magaging Director and chief executive officer by two years had removed a key overhang and reinforced leadership stability. MOFSL said ICICI Bank shares had delivered a modest 6 per cent return in FY26 so far, compared with an average 21 per cent return over FY23, FY24 and FY25. “The bank’s strong focus on core PPoP growth while fostering a cohesive organisational culture underpins its position as a resilient and successful institution,” MOFSL said. “The bank remains firmly on track to deliver RoA of 2.2 per cent in FY26E, despite one-off provisions in Q3, and RoE of 16 per cent over FY26-27. With the extension of Bakhshi’s term, the brokerage said the bank was well positioned to continue delivering best-in-class growth and profitability and remained one of the most dependable large-bank stories in the sector.
Sector: NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES 25/50, NIFTY PRIVATE BANK
Index: NIFTY 100, NIFTY 200, NIFTY 50, NIFTY 500, NIFTY BANK, NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES

headline: Half of India’s audited planes show repeated snags; Air India, IndiGo top list, reveals govt data
condensed_text: Air India Group, which includes Air India and Air India Express, reported an even higher ratio, with 191 out of the 267 aircraft that were checked – nearly 72 per cent – were found with repeat issues, according to Minister of State for Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol. Breaking down the figures, 137 of Air India’s 166 aircraft had repetitive defects, while 54 of 101 planes from Air India Express were flagged. An Air India spokesperson attributed the higher number of flagged aircraft to rigorous inspection protocols, stating that checks were conducted "out of an abundance of caution". The executive told news agency PTI that most issues related to lower-priority equipment, such as seats, tray tables, and screens, which fall under category D and are not related to aircraft safety. The regulator carried out 3,890 surveillance inspections, 56 regulatory audits, 84 surveillance of foreign aircraft (SOFA) checks, and 492 ramp inspections as part of scheduled monitoring activities.

headline: 'Clean, modern, not overcrowded': Foreigner’s Kolkata Metro praise goes viral, sparks debate on city’s public transport
condensed_text:
A foreign traveller’s praise for the Kolkata Metro has struck a chord online, after a post describing a smooth, uncrowded journey went viral on social media and triggered a wider debate on the city’s public transport system. In the post, they highlighted that the train was not overcrowded and described the system as “clean, modern, and good value.”
I've been on the #Kolkata metro before, but was impressed with how it wasn't overcrowded, along with being clean, modern, and good value 👏🇮🇳🚇 #India #NonstopEurotrip pic.twitter.com/MAGKN9g8y9
“I've been on the #Kolkata Metro before, but was impressed with how it wasn't overcrowded, along with being clean, modern, and good value,” the traveller wrote, tagging #India and #NonstopEurotrip. One of the most significant recent milestones has been the full operationalisation of the East-West Metro corridor, connecting Salt Lake Sector V with Howrah Maidan, including an under-river tunnel beneath the Hooghly. Ridership numbers underline the metro’s importance, with the network carrying over 8 lakh passengers on peak days, particularly during festivals and high-traffic periods. While commuters acknowledge crowding during rush hours, many online agreed that the Kolkata Metro remains affordable, reliable and relatively well maintained—qualities that, they say, deserve far more recognition than the system often receives.

headline: Why Gold/ Silver ETFs, NSDL, Stallion India, Federal Bank, SJVN, KRBL and Axis Bank will remain in focus on Friday
condensed_text:
The capital raising exercise will offer existing shareholders the opportunity to subscribe to additional shares in proportion to their current holdings, the company said in a release to the stock exchanges
Federal Bank Ltd said RBI has allowed Blackstone subsidiary, Asia II Topco XIII Pte Ltd, to acquire up to 9.99 per cent of the bank’s paid-up share capital or voting rights. Fitch Ratings has revised the outlook on Axis Bank Ltd’s Long-Term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) to Positive from Stable, and affirmed the IDR at ‘BB+’. Fitch has also upgraded the bank’s Viability Rating (VR) to ‘bb+’, from ‘bb’, and affirmed the Government Support Rating (GSR) at ‘bb+’. NSDL was expecting all delayed equity trades to be settled by Thursday night after a technical network disruption affected inter-depository settlement flows earlier this week, according to a businessline report. The issue was caused by instability in NSDL’s network systems, which temporarily disrupted connectivity with Central Depository Services (India) Ltd. (CDSL), a key link used for transferring securities across depository platforms.
Sector: NIFTY MIDSMALL FINANCIAL SERVICES, NIFTY PRIVATE BANK

headline: Tata Motors PV share price: Brokerages see up to 15% downside; stock up 2% today
condensed_text: Shares of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles ( TMPV ) climbed on Friday, following its Q3 FY26 earnings, even as it posted a consolidated net loss and heavy headwinds at its arm Jaguar Land Rover (JLR). The auto major reported a consolidated net loss of Rs 3,483 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025, from the consolidated net profit of Rs 4,164 crore recorded in the same quarter last year. "Q3 was a challenging quarter for JLR with performance impacted by the production shutdown we initiated in response to the cyber incident, the planned wind down of legacy Jaguar, and US tariffs," said PB Balaji, Chief Executive Officer, JLR. Brokerage firm Motilal Oswal Financial Services (MOFSL) maintained a 'Sell' rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 323, implying a potential downside of 15.1 per cent from current levels. "While India business continues to do well, JLR continues to face multiple headwinds, which include luxury tax in China hurting demand, impact of US tariffs, and rising VME (Variable Marketing Expenses)," it added.

headline: Indian stocks enjoy a rare combination, makes a case for re-rating: Morgan Stanley's Ridham Desai
condensed_text: Indian stocks, Desai argues in a strategy report, now offer an unusual mix of “inexpensive relative valuations, poor trailing performance, strong policy stimulus and a consequent growth upcycle, an undervalued currency, weak foreign positioning and potentially a new buyback cycle.” The 12-month trailing performance is “the worst in history” even as relative valuations are “approaching previous troughs”, with foreign portfolio investor (FPI) positioning having weakened steadily over the past four years. The report cites the combination of rate cuts, bank deregulation, liquidity infusion, continued capex, tax reductions and a “relatively stimulating budget” as evidence that “India’s hawkish macro set-up post-Covid is now unwinding.” Trade deals and a thaw in relations with China are seen as additional tailwinds to growth and risk appetite. Desai highlights that “the falling intensity of oil in GDP and rising share of exports in GDP, especially services, and fiscal consolidation imply a lower saving imbalance,” which in turn should allow “structurally lower real rates.” At the same time, lower inflation volatility, driven by supply-side reforms and flexible inflation targeting, should mean “volatility in interest rates and growth rates is likely falling in coming years.” Morgan Stanley’s base case sets a December 2026 Sensex target of 95,000, implying upside of 13% and a trailing P/E of 23.5 times, above the 25-year average of 22 times, to reflect “greater confidence in the medium-term growth cycle in India, India’s lower beta, a higher terminal growth rate and a predictable policy environment.” The base case rests on continued gains in macro stability through fiscal consolidation, increased private investment and a sustained positive gap between real growth and real rates, alongside “robust domestic growth, steady global growth and benign oil prices.” The bull case, with a 30% probability, pegs the Sensex at 107,000 by December 2026, assuming oil prices “persistently below US$60 per barrel”, successful reflation that lifts growth estimates, and a curtailment of the global trade war, with Sensex earnings compounding at 19% annually over FY25–28. The bear case, assigned a 20% probability, takes the Sensex down to 76,000 if oil spikes above US$90 per barrel, the RBI is forced to tighten, global growth slows materially and the US slips into recession, with earnings growth moderating to 15% and equity multiples de-rating to reflect a weaker macro environment. The firm’s proprietary leading earnings indicator “is suggesting improving earnings growth”, while its composite valuation indicator, which blends 11 absolute and relative metrics, points to “equity returns of around 16% in the next 12 months.” Sensex earnings in the base case are projected to compound at 17% annually through FY28, with the top-down framework for the broader market showing EPS growth of 22% in FY26, 20% in FY27 and 17% in FY28.

headline: Nuvama, BSE, other capital market stocks fall up to 4% as SEBI changes margin requirement for stock derivatives on expiry day
condensed_text: SEBI has decided that calendar spread margin benefits will not be available on the expiry day for single-stock derivative contracts expiring on that day, aligning the rule with index derivatives. In its circular, SEBI stated, “On the basis of references received from trading members regarding possible risks emanating from calendar spread benefits on the expiry day for single stocks, and subsequent deliberations with the Secondary Market Advisory Committee (SMAC) of SEBI, it has been decided that the benefit of offsetting positions across different expiries shall not be available on the day of expiry for contracts expiring on that day for single-stock derivatives.” However, SEBI clarified that existing margin calculations for calendar spread positions will remain unchanged for positions involving expiries other than the contracts expiring on a given day. If monthly expiries fall on the 29th (current month), 30th (next month), and 31st (far month), calendar spread positions involving contracts expiring on the 29th and 30th, or the 29th and 31st, will not be eligible for calendar spread treatment on the 29th (current month expiry). In the absence of such measures, SEBI noted that there is a risk of a sudden increase in margins on the day following the expiry of one leg of a calendar spread position, with limited recourse available to trading members in cases of margin shortfall or significant adverse price movement in the open leg. SEBI said the changes will align the calendar spread treatment for single-stock derivatives with that of index derivatives and provide sufficient time to end clients and trading members to bring in additional margin on the expiry day or to roll over or close calendar spread positions.

headline: Explained — Here's how the new SEBI regulation impacts BSE, Angel One, and Groww
condensed_text: Explained — Here's how the new SEBI regulation impacts BSE, Angel One, and Groww. Shares of Angel One, BSE, Billionbrains Garage Ventures , and 5paisa Capital, are trading with losses of up to 3% on Friday, February 6.While shares of Angel One and Groww are down up to 3% on Friday, those of BSE and 5Paisa are trading with cuts between 1% to 2%. Stocks are now recovering from those intraday lows.Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India  announced on Thursday evening that it has decided to remove the calendar spread benefits for single stock derivatives on expiry day.Earlier, traders could offset positions across different expiries, such as being long in the current month and being short in the next month) along with reduced margin requirements.However, the new regulation increases margin requirements on expiry day and could have a significant impact on volatility and liquidity on the expiry session. Calendar spread margin benefits will no longer be available on the day of expiry for single stock derivative contracts on that day.Now, on the day of the expiry, any spread involving the expiring contract including the current month, will be treated as two independent legs for margin purposes.The regulation's primary objective is to mitigate systemic risk and will be effective from May 5, 2026.Another rationale behind the move is to prevent margin gaps occurring on the day after expiry, and as a result, the Clearing Corporation faces a risk if price moves significantly against the unhedged leg before it can be liquidated.Shares of Angel One are looking to recover from the lows of the day, currently trading 1.5% lower at ₹2,605. Those of Groww have seen a significant recovery to turn positive, while BSE shares have also recovered from the lows of the day.
Sector: NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES EX-BANK, NIFTY MIDSMALL FINANCIAL SERVICES

headline: Nykaa share price jumps over 6% to 1-year high high after Q3 earnings
condensed_text: FSN E-Commerce Ventures , the parent of Indian beauty retailer Nykaa, saw its shares surge another 6.2% in Friday’s trade on February 6, hitting a 1-year high of ₹ 274.45 apiece. According to CNBC TV18 , Japanese brokerage firm Nomura upgraded Nykaa to a 'buy' from ‘hold’ and raised its price target to ₹ 305 from ₹ 261 earlier, implying an upside potential of 17% from Thursday’s closing price. It posted a 27% rise in consolidated revenue from core operations to ₹ 2,873 crore over the corresponding period last year, while the EBITDA stood at ₹ 230 crore, a 63% year-on-year jump, with margins expanding 180 basis points to 8% in Q3. The performance was boosted by strong demand for skincare and makeup products, with revenue from the beauty segment jumping 27% year-on-year to ₹ 2,622 crore in the December quarter, its filing showed. Nykaa reported a 26% jump in annual unique transacting customers (AUTC) in the beauty segment to 18.7 million customers and a 33% increase to 4.1 million customers in the fashion vertical.

headline: Cigarette companies stocks rise: ITC, Godfrey Phillips rise up to 11%; here's why
condensed_text: The stocks were trading at their highest level a month after they fell significantly after the Parliament in December approved the Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, clearing the way for a sharp increase in duties on cigarettes and other tobacco products. The finance ministry notified that an excise duty of Rs 2,050–8,500 per 1,000 sticks, depending on cigarette length, will take effect from February 1. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 315.84 crore a year ago, according to a regulatory filing from Godfrey Phillips India, the flagship company of Modi Enterprises. Its revenue from operations rose to Rs 21,707 crore for the third quarter compared to Rs 20,350 crore in the year-ago period, ITC Ltd said in a regulatory filing last month. Leaf tobacco prices have climbed in recent quarters at a time when export demand has picked up, weighing on ITC's profitability even as cigarette volumes have held up for India's market leader.

headline: Kaynes Technology reaffirms FY28 $1 bn sales target despite Q3 miss
condensed_text: Kaynes Technology has said it will continue to target $1 billion in revenue by the financial year 2027-28 , despite reporting October-December 2025 quarter results that came in below analyst estimates.CFO Jairam Sampath said the company’s long-term growth strategy remains linked to building an integrated electronics manufacturing platform. And, there are these quarterly numbers that are expected, despite a three-quarter growth of 37%, people do expect more, which I take as a positive sign, because I think it means that the public, the investors and customers, everybody is asking us to realise our potential.Fundamentally, this year, we will do about ₹1,700 crore in the fourth quarter, so that we can take up the quarterly number to about ₹4,100 crore. So, let's see where it lands.Q: Operating cash flows will be positive, right, when we reach the end of this fiscal year, correct?A: Absolutely.Also Read | 'I think market is making a mistake' — ICICI Pru AMC Co-CIO on why he avoids EMS companiesQ: What about the semiconductor facility that's expected?A: It will start this year. But I'm not able to commit numbers there yet, and that will be in addition to this ₹4,100 crore that we are talking about, which is our traditional - out of ₹4,400 crore, we had talked about ₹100 crore of revenues in the semiconductor area.I want to bring a very important distinction here. So, going forward, $1 billion and $2 billion numbers, etc., will become more of a reality.Q: $1 billion by 2028, that's on, right?A: That's on.Q: A lot of sell-side analysts, all of last evening, were saying that maybe Kaynes Technologies had given some kind of hint that Q3 is going to be sort of a washout.

headline: Alembic Pharma secures USFDA final nod for Parkinson’s therapy tablets
condensed_text: Alembic Pharmaceuticals Limited on Friday, February 6, said it has received final approval from the US Food and Drug Administration  for its Abbreviated New Drug Application  for Carbidopa, Levodopa and Entacapone tablets, strengthening its presence in the US generics market.In a regulatory filing, the company said the approval covers multiple strengths of the combination therapy, including 12.5 mg/50 mg/200 mg, 18.75 mg/75 mg/200 mg, 25 mg/100 mg/200 mg, 31.25 mg/125 mg/200 mg, 37.5 mg/150 mg/200 mg and 50 mg/200 mg/200 mg. The product is therapeutically equivalent to Stalevo tablets of Orion Corporation, the reference listed drug.Carbidopa, levodopa and entacapone tablets are indicated for the treatment of Parkinson’s disease, the company said, adding that usage is subject to the approved label.With this approval, Alembic’s cumulative ANDA approvals from the USFDA now stand at 234, comprising 214 final approvals and 20 tentative approvals.For the December quarter, the company reported a 10.8% year-on-year rise in revenue to ₹1,876.3 crore. EBITDA grew 12.8% to ₹293.5 crore, while margins improved marginally to 15.6% from 15.4% a year ago. Net profit declined 4.1% YoY to ₹132 crore, impacted by a one-time expense of ₹42 crore linked to employee benefits following changes under the new labour code.Shares of Alembic Pharma were trading 2.45% down at ₹790.60 as of 12.08 pm on Friday. The stock has declined 16.63% in the past six months.Also Read: ITC shares see biggest single-day gain in 18 months after worst January on record

headline: Suzlon Energy shares: Motilal Oswal sees 55% upside; ICICI flags execution bottlenecks
condensed_text: Suzlon Energy’s consolidated revenue was below estimates as deliveries reached 617MW, 8 per cent lower than forecast, with Ebitda and adjusted net profit also coming lower than expectations, said Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd. For the three months ended on December 31, 2025, Suzlon Energy clocked a 14.8 per cent year-on-year (YoY) jump in the net profit at Rs 445.2 crore, while its revenue increased 42.4 per cent YoY to Rs 4,228.1 crore. The company's ebitda increased 48 per cent YoY to Rs 730.5 crore, while ebitda margins improved 70 basis points YoY to 17.3 per cent for the reported period. With strong order book and 4.5GW operational capacity, it has also been able to ramp up execution, delivering 1.6GW worth of wind turbines in 9 months, said ICICI Securities. Motilal Oswal’s valuation applies a target P/E of 30 times to FY28 estimated EPS, setting a price target of Rs 74 (suggest 55 per cent upside), slightly above the historical average two-year forward P/E of 27 times.

Bharti Airtel Q3 Results:
Bharti Airtelreported a consolidated net profit of Rs 6,631 crore for Q3 FY26, marking a 55 percent YoY fall from the Rs 14,781 crore net profit reported in Q3 FY25. However, more importantly, BHARTI’s FCF generation improved further to INR169b (INR458b in 9MFY26), which led to ~INR140b reduction in net debt (excl. This implies an upside potential of nearly 13 percent from the stock’s previous closing price The international brokerage said that the company’s third-quarter was operationally in line, supported by ARPU-led margin expansion and strong free cash flow. The international brokerage noted that the firm delivered a steady quarter with improving free cash flow, resilient wireless growth and easing capex intensity
ICICI Securities highlighted the company's resilient India wireless performance, steady ARPU growth, margin expansion and lower net debt on strong cash generation. “We largely maintain our FY27/28 EBITDA stimates and our SELL rating (given heady valuations; ~74x FY28 EV/EBITDA), with a DCF-based TP of INR 205/sh, implying 58x FY28 EV/EBITDA,” it said.

headline: UPI stocks in focus: Paytm, MobiKwik shares fall up to 3.5%; is this RBI announcement the possible reason?
condensed_text: UPI stocks in focus: Paytm, MobiKwik shares fall up to 3.5%; is this RBI announcement the possible reason?. UPI stocks like Paytm,MobiKwikfaced selling pressure and fell up to 3.5% on February 6 after Reserve Bank of India Governor Sanjay Malhotra said RBI will propose a framework to compensate customers up to Rs 25,000 for losses incurred in small-value fraudulent transactions. The unprecedented growth in digital payments over the past decade has been accompanied by "growing sophistication of fraudulent activities targeting innocent customers", the RBI said. Indian banks reported 13,469 cases of frauds relating to card and internet-based transactions amounting to losses of Rs 520 crore in fiscal year 2024-25 after 29,080 frauds and losses of Rs 1,457 crore in 2023-24, RBI data showed. "There is a framework which we will be taking out for compensation of small frauds because we have observed while in value, they constitute small proportion, but in numbers 65% have less than Rs 55,000 in terms of amount," said Governor Malhotra at post-monetary policy press conference.

headline: Why Tata Motors’ India PV business may not offset JLR’s cyber drag: Jefferies explains
condensed_text: International brokerage Jefferies has highlighted mounting pressures at Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) after Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles (TMPV) reported a weak December quarter, with EBITDA plunging 91% YoY to about Rs 940 crore, though the performance was better than the brokerage’s estimates. While Q4 is expected to be better as production is likely to normalise in the March quarter as the cyberattack impact fades, Jefferies believes JLR continues to face several structural challenges that could weigh on profitability and growth. Jefferies noted that JLR’s break-even level has risen, with the business delivering an average EBITDA margin of just 3.6% in 9MFY26 on average quarterly volumes of 71,000 units, compared with over 9.6% margins in Q2 and Q3 FY22 at around 67,000 units per quarter. Jefferies expects Tata’s PV volumes to rise 18% YoY in FY26 and grow at an 11% CAGR over FY26 to FY28, with EBITDA margins improving toward 7.5 to 8.0% by FY27 to FY28. It expects FY27 and FY28 to be better than FY26 but estimates FY28 EPS to remain 26% below FY25 levels, with FY27 and FY28 EPS still 23 to 33% below Street expectations.

headline: AI impact on Indian IT to be worse than expected, says Bhavin Shah
condensed_text: The biggest risk for Indian IT stocks is that AI-led revenue deflation will be far worse than the 2–3% the market is currently factoring in — and that could force both earnings downgrades and valuation cuts, warns Bhavin Shah, Founder, CIO and CEO of Sameeksha Capital.Shah said the scale of productivity gains being reported across the industry has risen sharply in just a few months and will directly shrink the revenue pool for IT services companies. AI is surprising us with the magnitude of impact it is having latest… in areas that we had earlier probably not even anticipated.”Even if margins are protected, Shah warned, “if revenues are not growing or see erosion, that would obviously lead to an impact on EPS.”From an investor’s point of view, the bigger near-term risk is valuation. “When there is such a fast-moving technology having such a massive impact, many will prefer to stay on the sidelines and sort of wait it out — and that means there is definitely a risk for further multiple contraction,” Shah said.Also Read: Is it time to buy IT stocks yet? “By the time we finish a project, we might realise we could have done this differently based on the availability of some new AI tool.”Also Read: Devina Mehra on IT stocks: No reason to panic sell or bottom-fish right nowReflecting this caution, Shah said his firm is re-evaluating its IT holdings and confirmed that the direction is towards selling. He added that Sameeksha Capital had already sharply reduced its global technology exposure, warning that in the global AI race “there are several horses, all spending very aggressively — and chances are not all will be winners,” keeping both earnings and valuations under pressure.For the entire interview, watch the accompanying videoCatch all the latest updates from the stock market here

headline: Buy Astral; target of Rs 1794 Prabhudas Lilladher
condensed_text:
Prabhudas Lilladher's research report onAstral
Astral Ltd (ASTRA) reported healthy volume growth of 16.8% in the plastic pipe segment despite a weak demand environment. EBITDA per kg for the plastic pipes segment stood at Rs31.7 (₹~35/kg excluding inventory loss). Additionally, the company expects the removal of China’s VAT rebate, which could lead to a Rs7–10/kg increase in PVC prices (already Rs7/kg PVC price hike during Jan–Feb’26), potentially supporting higher volumes. Outlook
We estimate sales/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 15.9%/18.7%/26.4% over FY26-28E. For all recommendations report,click here

headline: Realty shares extend decline as RBI holds policy rate; Oberoi Realty, DLF among key laggards
condensed_text: Realty shares extended their decline on Friday after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept the policy rate unchanged at the end of its three-day monetary policy meeting. The RBI’s decision to keep the repo rate unchanged is, however, expected to help stabilise interest rates and support housing market momentum, according to developers and real estate sector experts. Sahil Agrawal, Chief Executive Officer of Nimbus Group, said the move to hold the repo rate at 5.25 percent supports a mature housing cycle. The RBI’s six-member Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on February 6 unanimously voted to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.25 percent, while retaining a neutral policy stance. The RBI kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged as inflation remained at manageable levels and growth concerns eased amid increased government spending and lower tariff pressures following a trade deal with the United States.

headline: Govt set to exit IDBI Bank in FY26; Kotak, Emirates NBD, and Fairfax to place final bids this week
condensed_text: Moneycontrolhad reported on January 30that three short-listed bidders--Kotak Mahindra Bank, Emirates NBD and Fairfax India Holdings-- have been asked to place final bids for the acquisition of 61 percent stake in IDBI Bank by February 5. Once financial bids are submitted, sources say the bids will be opened in the presence of the transaction advisers, members of the inter-ministerial group (IMG) and authorised representatives of the bidders. In a post-Budget interaction on February 1, DIPAM Secretary Arunish Chawla had said that the strategic divestment of IDBI Bank had moved to the third phase – meaning technical and financial bids have been invited. While the proposal for disinvestment of IDBI Bank was first mooted in February 2020 when the finance minister presented her Budget for FY21, a request for proposal (RFP) was sent in October 2022. The Reserve Bank of India is said to have cleared four interested bidders from a ‘fit and proper’ standpoint – namely Kotak Mahindra Bank, Fairfax India Holdings, Emirates NBD and Oaktree Capital.

headline: Fortis Healthcare sets board meeting date to declare Q3 results 2026
condensed_text:
Fortis Healthcare sets board meeting date to declare Q3 results 2026. The board of directors of Fortis Healthcare Limited is scheduled to meet on Friday, February 13, 2026 to consider and approve Q3 results, as per the company's announcement in an exchange filing.
“….the Board of Directors of the Company will be held on Friday, February 13, 2026, to inter-alia, consider and approve the Un-audited Financial Results (Standalone and Consolidated) of the Company for the quarter and period ended December 31, 2025,” said the company in an exchange filing.
(more to come)
Sector: NIFTY HEALTHCARE INDEX, NIFTY MIDSMALL HEALTHCARE, NIFTY500 HEALTHCARE

headline: ITC, Godfrey Phillips, other cigarette stocks jump up to 13% amid reports of price hike
condensed_text: Shares of cigarette makers, including ITC , Godfrey Phillips and VST Industries , surged up to 13% on Friday after reports indicated companies had raised prices following the recent tax hike, passing on higher costs to consumers. Under the new framework, excise duties on cigarettes were restructured to a range of Rs 2,050 to Rs 8,500 per 1,000 sticks, alongside a 40% GST. However, the Budget also clarified that the effective duty rate will continue at 25% through a notification, meaning there is no immediate increase in tax outgo for cigarette companies. In the December quarter, ITC reported 6.2% year-on-year revenue growth, driven by double-digit growth in FMCG-Others and steady momentum in cigarettes. Margins in the cigarette segment, however, slipped to a multi-quarter low of 59.9%, contracting 163 basis points YoY due to the consumption of high-cost leaf inventory.

headline: Astral sees stronger Q4 outlook as demand improves and margins set to rise
condensed_text: Ahmedabad-based manufacturer of building materials Astral Limited remains optimistic about the fourth quarter, traditionally the strongest period for the building materials industry, driven by seasonal demand and operating leverage benefits.With Astral holding low-cost inventory and benefiting from recent price increases, margins are expected to improve sequentially.Strong restocking activity and a visible uptick in demand since December have further strengthened confidence of surpassing third-quarter volume levels, even in a rising price environment.Hiranand Savlani, Executive Director and Chief Financial Officer of Astral Limited, said the company is likely to come close to achieving double-digit topline growth for the full year, even though revenue growth stands at around 8% for the first nine months.Beyond plumbing, Astral continues to invest in scaling up its adhesives, paints, and bathware businesses, which are steadily gaining traction despite being at a relatively early stage.While margins in these segments may remain modest in the near term due to expansion-led costs, the company expects strong topline growth and improved profitability over the medium term as scale benefits kick in.In October-December quarter , Astral reported revenue of ₹1,542 crore, net profit of ₹108 crore, and margin of 15.39%. What is the situation that you are seeing on the ground currently and do you believe that, based on what you have witnessed so far does that improve in the fourth quarter, going into the final quarter of the year?A: If you see industry dynamics, the industry is not growing that high because Astral did a lot of decentralisation in the recent time and because of that, our volumes were excellent. We are expecting the volume will further inch up, because the industry was passing through a very tough time.Last three years, if you see the polymer prices were going down, and this is the first quarter where we are seeing that, at least now the bottom out is being taken place, and from here on, the prices have started going up. We are expecting better volume than what was there in Q3.Q: Do you think you will exceed your volume growth despite higher prices, and if you could break your Q4 targets, volume and value-wise?A: Normally, whenever the price rise is there, a lot of restocking take place in the street. Since you mentioned you are on fairly decent, low priced inventory right now, when do you expect the realisations to recover?A: Q4 onward you will see the realisation will start picking up.Q: From a medium- to long-term standpoint, what kind of revenue mix are you expecting coming in from the PVC plumbing business?

headline: Greaves Cotton Q3 Results: Profit jumps 23% YoY as margin expands
condensed_text: Greaves Cotton Q3 Results: Profit jumps 23% YoY as margin expands. Greaves Cotton Ltd posted healthy set of numbers for the December quarter  on January 6, reporting a 22.6% year-on-year increase in net profit at ₹25.5 crore, compared with ₹20.8 crore in the year ago period.Revenue for the quarter rose 16.6% YoY to ₹875.5 crore from ₹750.6 crore in Q3 FY25, reflecting steady growth across its business segments. Operating performance strengthened materially, with EBITDA surging 56.3% YoY to ₹61.8 crore, up from ₹39.5 crore a year earlier.Improved operating leverage and cost efficiencies drove a notable expansion in margins, which stood at 7% in Q3 FY26 compared with 5.3% in the corresponding quarter last year.Following the earnings announcement, shares of Greaves Cotton were trading at ₹172.18 on the NSE, up 1.64% on the day, after touching an intraday high of ₹177.50.Also Read: Kaynes Tech Q3 Results: Shares fall 6% after earnings miss across the board, guidance cutGreaves Cotton is a diversified engineering company with a presence across clean mobility, power, farm equipment, aftermarket solutions and retail electric mobility through its EV-focused businesses.

headline: Shah Rukh Khan to reunite with Farah Khan after 12 years for Main Hoon Na 2? What we know
condensed_text: Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Farah Khan will reportedly reunite after almost 12 years for Main Hoon Na 2, a sequel to their 2004 blockbuster. Shah Rukh is currently working on his next theatrical release, King.It was reported last year that the filmmaker was working on a script, and the project now appears to be a priority for the duo.According to a report by Pinkvilla, the actor-director duo is reportedly in discussions for a reunion for Main Hoon Na 2, a frontrunner for the superstar's upcoming release, King. The idea is said to elevate the emotion and entertainment quotient of the sequel, while SRK will explore two contrasting characters," sources told the outlet.Also Read: Makers of Ghooskhor Pandat pull promotional materials, Director Neeraj Pandey says, 'We understand the hurt’For the sequel, the makers plan to reunite the original ensemble with new stars, and it will be a patriotic film like the first instalment. It has been confirmed by sources that the core story idea was personally conceived by Shah Rukh Khan and has since been transitioned into a full screenplay by writer Aakash Kaushik.While the project is in active development, a final decision is expected after SRK hears a full narration around May 2026, after wrapping up King. He will take a call on the project post the narration, while the writing process continues in full swing," it added.Main Hoon Naa, the debut directorial of Farah Khan, hit the cinemas in 2004.

headline: Data Patterns shares rise 9% on Q3 earnings, record high order book; check details
condensed_text:
Sentiment was also positive after the defence firm reported its highest ever order book at Rs 1,868 crore (Rs 760 crore orders confirmed plus Rs 1107.8 crore negotiated/awaited) as of Q3 FY26. Revenue in Q3 rose 39% to Rs 179 crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2025 compared to Rs 128 crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2024. S. Rangarajan, Chairman & Managing Director, Data Patterns (India) said, “We are encouraged by the strong performance in Q3 and 9MFY26, driven by robust execution and sustained demand across key programs and segments. With a strong executable pipeline, we remain confident of achieving our full-year guidance.”
For the nine months ended December 2025, the revenue rose 73% to Rs 602.22 crore from Rs 347.86 crore for the nine months ended December 31, 2024. Net profit rose 23% to Rs 132.99 crore for the nine months ended December 31, 2025 from Rs 107.73 crore in the nine months ended December 31, 2024.

headline: Uno Minda targets firmer growth on expanding product pipeline, deeper engagement with OEMs: CFO
condensed_text: As Uno Minda sharpens its focus on technology-led products, premium feature adoption and electrification, the company remains confident of sustaining growth ahead of the broader auto industry, supported by a strong and expanding product pipeline and deeper engagement with original equipment manufacturer  customers across segments.That confidence is underpinned by a steady financial performance. In the October-December quarter of 2025 , year-on-year, Uno Minda reported revenue growth of 20% at ₹5,018 crore , earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation  up 21% at ₹554 crore  and an EBITDA margin of 11% .The Gurugram-based company has a market capitalisation of about ₹68,034.31 crore, and its shares have gained nearly 14% over the past year.Below are the edited excerpts from the interview with Sunil Bohra, Group Chief Financial Officer, Uno Minda Group.Q: India–US and India–EU, the free trade agreements , in what way does this change things for the Indian auto component sector, and what are the tangible benefits that you see?A: It definitely opens up a lot of opportunities for exports from India. Now that we have the clarity, things will speed up, and it will definitely open up a lot of opportunities for exports of auto and auto components.Also Read: Bajaj Auto sees export run-rate holding above 2 lakh units a monthQ: When we look at the auto sales numbers, it looks like the entry-level cars have done better, and that impacts the value proposition for you — yours is a premiumisation play. We are not going to give actual growth numbers because we do not normally talk about the OE one, but definitely our endeavour has consistently been, on an annual basis, whatever the industry grows, we consistently grow at least 1.5 times or more, and we are pretty confident that we should be able to deliver that.Q: How do you see the business evolving from here on? Some of the two-wheeler components will get into production next fiscal year.There are a lot of these products which will get into SOP at the end of 2026 and early 2027, so this consistently will help us improve our offering per vehicle, which will actually translate into the actual realisable.

headline: Bharti Airtel awaits DoT response on AGR parity request: Gopal Vittal
condensed_text:
Bharti Airtel is still awaiting a response from the government on its request seeking clarity over the treatment of its adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues, with Executive Vice Chairman Gopal Vittal stating that the company has formally written a couple of letters to the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) requesting parity in the handling of these liabilities. Responding to analysts’ queries on AGR during the Q3 earnings call, Vittal said the telecom operator has already sent multiple letters to the DoT seeking clarification and equal treatment on the dues issue. While Vittal did not elaborate on the specifics of the relief or parity being sought, his remarks indicate that Airtel is closely monitoring any policy or administrative developments related to AGR liabilities and is seeking consistency in the government’s approach across operators. These are areas we have written to the DoT about, seeking an assessment based on parity and in line with the Supreme Court ruling.”
The comments come after the Union Cabinet last month froze Vodafone Idea’s AGR dues at Rs 87,695 crore as of December 31, 2025, and approved a staggered repayment schedule allowing the telco to clear the outstanding amount between FY32 and FY41. Meanwhile,Bharti Airtel’sdeferred payment liability towards AGR stood at Rs 38,604 crore, according to its FY25 annual report.

headline: Paisalo Digital Q3 Results: Net profit remains flat at₹66 crore
condensed_text: Paisalo Digital , a constituent of the BSE Smallcap index, announced its December quarter results on Thursday, reporting a consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹ 66.3 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2025, compared with ₹ 62.4 crore in the year-ago period. Total income for the December quarter stood at ₹ 240.1 crore, up from ₹ 203.8 crore in the corresponding quarter last year and ₹ 224.0 crore in Q2 FY26. In late January, the company had announced that it had redeemed ₹ 1 crore of unlisted, unsecured, redeemable, non-convertible debentures (NCDs) by exercising an early call option. Earlier this year, Paisalo Digital raised ₹ 188.5 crore as part of its efforts to optimise funding costs, improve capital efficiency, and support business expansion. In an exchange filing dated January 6, the company said it had “successfully raised nearly ₹ 188.5 crore at an annual ROI of 8.5% through its latest listed issuances in Q3,” adding that the fundraise underscored its strong credit profile, prudent risk-management practices, and solid balance-sheet position.

headline: Gateway Distriparks Q3: Net profit tanks 85% on consolidation impact; declares dividend
condensed_text: Multimodal logistics firm Gateway Distriparks Ltd on Friday  reported its Q3 results with net profit declining 85% year-on-year to ₹68 crore from ₹455.4 crore.Revenue grew 39.2% year-on-year to ₹560.4 crore compared with ₹402.5 crore in the same quarter last year. The special interim dividend is a one-time, non-recurring payout, declared in recognition of the company achieving a net debt-free position for the first time since inception and marking 30 years since the acquisition of land for its first facility, the Nhava Sheva CFS.Also Read: Gateway Distriparks to build ₹150 crore Indore cargo terminal for 1.2 lakh containersProfit before tax was reported at ₹-3.20 crore, with year-to-date PBT at ₹-3.48 crore. These figures were impacted due to the consolidation of accounts after Snowman Logistics transitioned from an associate company to a subsidiary effective December 24, 2024.An exceptional income of ₹390.77 crore arising from fair valuation of equity and assets on consolidation of Snowman Logistics Ltd, which became a subsidiary from December 24, 2024, was included in PBT and PAT of Q3 and year-to-date FY25. This exceptional income has been removed from the reported figures above to ensure comparability of numbers.Prem Kishan Dass Gupta, Chairman & Managing Director, said, "Normally, Q3 is a weaker quarter, but our numbers continued to remain strong in line with the last few quarters. When all these agreements get ratified, it will lead to a big boost in global trade for India.Also Read: Gateway Distriparks aims to quadruple domestic cargo volumes in 2 years via Ankleshwar dealAdditionally, we started our domestic rail services from MMLP New Ankleshwar in October 2025 and are seeing continued traction.

headline: Shilpa Medicare delivers strong Q3: Profit up 40%, sales surge and margins improve
condensed_text: Revenue for the quarter rose 28% to ₹409 crore from ₹319.3 crore a year ago, reflecting improved operational performance.Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation  increased 41% year-on-year to ₹113.6 crore, as against ₹80.6 crore in the year-ago quarter. The EBITDA margin improved to 27.8% from 25.2% in the same period last year, indicating better cost efficiency and operating leverage during the quarter.The improvement in profitability was supported by strong growth across key financial metrics, with both revenue and operating profit registering healthy year-on-year expansion. The higher margin performance underscores the company’s focus on improving operational efficiencies during the quarter under review.Shilpa Medicare Q2 performanceIn the second quarter, Shilpa Medicare had reported a sharp improvement in profitability, with net profit rising 144% year-on-year to ₹44 crore, compared with ₹18 crore in the same quarter of the previous year. Revenue for the quarter increased 7.6% year-on-year to ₹370 crore from ₹344 crore.EBITDA in Q2 grew 26% to ₹108.8 crore, up from ₹86.2 crore a year earlier. Operating margin for the quarter improved significantly to 29.4%, compared with 25% in the corresponding period last year, reflecting stronger operating performance.Also read: Shilpa Medicare Q2 Results | Net profit doubles to ₹44 crore on higher marginsOn the stock market, shares of Shilpa Medicare Limited  closed higher on the NSE at ₹323, up 2.25%.

headline: Adani Power re-positions its fleet of thermal plants as grid balancers; targets 24 GW capacity addition
condensed_text:
FILE PHOTO: A view shows high-tension electricity power line pylon outside Adani Power's thermal power generation plant at Mundra in the western state of Gujarat, India
AMIT DAVE
As India’s power grid tilts rapidly towards renewables, Adani Power is repositioning its thermal fleet as a support system for grid stability, with plants increasingly acting as balancing power sources to enable larger renewable integration, even as the company rolls out a 24-GW capacity expansion plan through FY32 backed by long-term power purchase agreements. The (thermal) power plants will now act more as balancing power plants and therefore the focus will be on keeping the plant uptime as high as possible, rather than actually trying to maximise the PLF,” said Dilip Jha, Chief Financial Officer of Adani Power. The power plants that we are setting up… will use a lesser amount of coal to generate higher amounts of power — up to 5–10 percent of advantage when compared to older technology,” he recently told investors adding that most projects are located close to coal sources, helping lower logistics costs. Mahan Phase-2 is around 80 per cent complete, Raipur Phase-2 about 44 per cent, Raigarh Phase-2 close to 38 pe rcent, while construction at Korba Phase-2 has resumed, the company said. In FY28, another 2.4 GW, FY29 another 2.4 GW, FY30 about 8 GW, FY31 around 5.6 GW and another 2.4 GW thereafter,” Jha said, adding that the revived Korba Phase-2 project will see its first unit commissioned by mid-next year and the second by year-end.

headline: Telcos owe govt ₹1.77 lakh cr in AGR dues till FY25; Voda Idea liability at ₹89,952 cr
condensed_text: Telcos owe govt ₹1.77 lakh cr in AGR dues till FY25; Voda Idea liability at ₹89,952 cr. Telecom operators' total adjusted gross revenue dues up to the financial year 2024-25 payable to the government stood at over ₹1.77 lakh crore, according to official data shared with Parliament. The data show that the total liability on debt-ridden Vodafone Idea (Vi) stands at ₹89,952 crore, Bharti Group ₹51,091 crore, Tata Group ₹20,426 crore, MTNL ₹14,462 crore and Reliance Jio Infocomm ₹1,984 crore. In the case of Vodafone Idea Limited (VIL), the AGR dues pertaining to the period from FY2006–07 to FY 2018–19 have been frozen at ₹87,695 crore. "The Committee comprises a retired Secretary-level officer of the Government of India and a representative of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG), as nominated by the CAG.

headline: Mahindra & Mahindra to invest ₹15,000 crore to build vehicle manufacturing plant in Nagpur
condensed_text:
The decade-long investment plan includes acquiring over 2,000 acres across three locations, including a 150-acre supplier park in Sambhajinagar and land in the Igatpuri-Nashik region. (A file photo)
WALDO SWIEGERS
Mahindra & Mahindra said on Friday it will invest ₹15,000 crore to set up manufacturing facility in Nagpur , Maharashtra with the capacity to produce 5 lakh vehicles and 1 lakh tractors annually. The company said the facility, its largest in the country, will be developed over an area of 1,500 acres in Vidarbha with a 150-acre supplier park in Sambhajinagar. It will also acquire land in the Igatpuri-Nashik region to expand current product and engine capacities, as well as to support the growth of its Advanced Technology business. The automotive facility will support Mahindra Auto’s next-generation platforms, including the NU_IQ architecture, and will be capable of manufacturing vehicles across multiple powertrains including internal combustion engine, electric vehicles and future technologies—for both domestic and global markets.

headline: Top Gainers & Losers: Hitachi Energy, MRF, Nykaa, HUL among top gainers
condensed_text: The Indian stock market turned into the green in Friday’s session on February 6 after a range-bound trade, supported by gains in FMCG and select private banking stocks, which helped offset losses in IT, pharma and auto shares. At its sixth and final bi-monthly monetary policy review for the current financial year, the central bank decided to retain the repo rate at 5.25% and maintained a neutral stance. In terms of sector-wise performance, Nifty FMCG led the gainers with a 2.27% surge, while Nifty Consumer Durables, Nifty Oil & Gas, and Nifty Realty also ended higher, posting gains of up to 1%. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Investments Limited, said, "Domestic equity markets traded largely subdued through most of the session before staging a late recovery, supported by selective buying in FMCG and private banking stocks. However, markets had anticipated a mildly dovish undertone, which failed to materialise as the RBI retained its neutral stance, resulting in an uptick in India’s 10-year bond yields," he further added.

headline: Maruti Suzuki inks pact with Andhra Pradesh for four automated driving test tracks
condensed_text:
Hisashi Takeuchi, MD and CEO, Maruti Suzuki India
Maruti Suzuki India on Friday said it has inked a pact with Andhra Pradesh government for the setting up and maintenance of four automated driving test tracks across the state. The tracks will be set up at four Regional Transport Office (RTO) locations in the state, namely Eluru, Ongole, Vizianagaram, and Anakapalli. Aligned with his vision for technology-led solutions, we are honoured to bring 4 Automated Driving Test Tracks (ADTTs) to the state of Andhra Pradesh," Maruti Suzuki India MD and CEO Hisashi Takeuchi said in a statement. "The automation of driving test tracks is expected to bring greater uniformity and objectivity in the testing process and ensure that driving licenses are issued only to candidates with the requisite driving skills, thereby strengthening road safety in the state," Andhra Pradesh Transport Commissioner Manish Kumar Sinha stated. The ADTTs in Eluru, Vizianagaram, Ongole and Anakapalli will serve light motor vehicles and two-wheeler driving license applicants.

headline: Kalyan Jewellers India Q3 net profit nearly doubles YoY to Rs 416 crore; inventory gains help
condensed_text: Kalyan Jewellers India Q3 net profit nearly doubles YoY to Rs 416 crore; inventory gains help. Kalyan Jewellers India Q3 FY26 net profit jumped over 90 percent year-on-year to Rs 416.3 crore, driven by higher sales and inventory gains. The jewellery company's revenue from operations for the fiscal third quarter rose 42 percent on-year to Rs 10,343.4 crore.

headline: Bharat Electronics receives orders worth ₹581 crore, including radar and communication equipment
condensed_text: Navratna defence PSU Bharat Electronics Ltd  on Friday  said it has secured additional orders worth ₹581 crore since its last disclosure on January 23, 2026.The orders include a range of defence-related products and services such as communication equipment, radar warning receivers, tank sub-systems, radar systems, software solutions, upgrades, spares and related services.BEL's revenue for the period increased by 23.7% to ₹7,122 crore from ₹5,756 crore last year. The figure was higher than the CNBC-TV18 poll of ₹6,710 crore. Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation  increased by 28% year-on-year to ₹2,117 crore, which was also higher than the CNBC-TV18 poll of ₹1,884 crore.Also Read: BEL share price can go up to ₹565, scale new peaks, analysts say after strong Q3EBITDA margin expanded by 100 basis points to 29.7% from 28.7% last year. A CNBC-TV18 poll had, in fact, projected a 60 basis points contraction in its margins to 28.1%.Net profit for the period saw a growth of 20.8% year-on-year to ₹1,590 crore, higher than the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of ₹1,474 crore. The growth in profitability is despite a ₹16.6 crore impact due to the new labour laws.Shares of Bharat Electronics Ltd ended at ₹429.55, down by ₹3.30, or 0.76%, on the BSE.Also Read: Bharat Electronics wins fresh orders worth ₹610 crore

headline: GNA Axles clocks 26% profit jump in Q3 as margins surge, revenue stays flat
condensed_text: Revenue for the quarter remained flat at ₹375 crore on a year-on-year basis.Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation  rose 32.4% year-on-year to ₹69.4 crore, as against ₹52.4 crore in the year-ago quarter. The EBITDA margin improved sharply to 18.5% from 14% in the same period last year, reflecting stronger operating performance despite stable topline growth.The improvement in profitability was driven by better operating leverage during the quarter, with margins expanding significantly on a year-on-year basis. While revenue remained unchanged compared to the previous year, higher EBITDA growth translated into a notable rise in net profit for the quarter under review.GNA Axles Q2 PerformanceIn the second quarter, GNA Axles had reported a mixed performance, with net profit rising 3.3% year-on-year to ₹28.5 crore, compared with ₹27.6 crore in the same period last year. Revenue for the quarter declined 4.1% year-on-year to ₹387.5 crore from ₹404.2 crore in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal.EBITDA in Q2 fell 4.5% to ₹52.5 crore from ₹55 crore a year earlier. Despite the decline in revenue and EBITDA, the company managed to maintain its margins at 13.5%, slightly lower than 13.6% recorded in the year-ago quarter, indicating stable operating efficiency amid topline pressure.Margins in Q3 showed a marked improvement compared with Q2 levels, supported by stronger EBITDA growth and improved cost management.Also read: GNA Axles Q2 results: Net profit rises 3.3% to ₹28.5 crore, revenue slips 4.1%On the stock market, shares of GNA Axles Limited closed higher on the NSE at ₹440, up 7.92% on Friday.

headline: Adani Power vs Tata Power: Fresh share price targets, key financials post Q3 earnings
condensed_text:
In terms of financials, Adani Power has clocked delivered strong profit CAGR of 65.7% and a revenue CAGR of 93.9% over the last 5 years. Total 1.13 lakh shares of the firm changed hands amounting to a turnover of Rs 4.08 crore
JM Financial has a price target of Rs 177 on the Adani Group stock. "With key enablers in place (land, EC, PPAs, and equipment) and management’s assurance of timely commissioning of projects, we expect operational capacity to reach 39.5 GW by FY32 and EBITDA/MW to increase from Rs 1.3 crore /MW in FY25 to Rs 1.8 crore/MW by FY32. Given the lower growth in power demand across the country in 9MFY26, resulting in lower realisation in merchant sale, which formed 20% of its power sales and lower PLFs, we revise our FY26E earnings. We maintain BUY, with an SOTP-based revised target price of Rs 429 (a 15% upside) implying 12.6 times EV/EBITDA and 2.8x P/B on FY28," said JM Financial.

headline: Kalyan Jewellers Q3 Results: Profit surges 90% YoY to₹416 crore
condensed_text: Kalyan Jewellers Q3 Results: Profit surges 90% YoY to₹416 crore. Kalyan Jewellers Q3 Results: Profit surges 90% YoY to ₹ 416 crore

headline: Crompton Greaves Q3 Results: Profit, margin beat estimates but slip YoY; revenue rises
condensed_text: Crompton Greaves Q3 Results: Profit, margin beat estimates but slip YoY; revenue rises. Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals Ltd delivered a mixed but largely better-than-expected performance in the December quarter on February 06, beating CNBC-TV18 estimates on key operational metrics, even as net profit declined year-on-year.The company reported a net profit of ₹101 crore, ahead of the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of ₹98 crore, though lower than ₹112 crore recorded in the year-ago period, marking a 9.8% decline.Revenue rose 7.3% year-on-year to ₹1,898 crore, surpassing estimates of ₹1,864 crore and compared with ₹1,769 crore a year earlier.EBITDA came in at ₹194.6 crore, significantly higher than the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of ₹166 crore and marginally above ₹191 crore reported last year, reflecting a 1.9% year-on-year increase.EBITDA margin stood at 10.3%, well above the estimated 8.9%, but lower than 10.8% in the corresponding quarter last year.The company said it recognised an incremental exceptional liability of around ₹20.04 crore during the quarter after reassessing employee benefit obligations under the New Labour Codes. It added that any differential impact would be accounted for once the rules are formally notified.Separately, Crompton announced the launch of insulated wires and cables for the domestic market, scheduled for the end of March 2026, marking an expansion into the electrical wires and cables segment.Ahead of the earnings announcement, shares of Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals closed 1.11% lower at ₹243.90 on the NSE.Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals is a leading player in consumer durables, with a presence across fans, lighting, pumps, appliances and electrical products.

headline: Star Cement Q3: Profit jumps over eight-fold on strong margins, revenue growth
condensed_text: Star Cement Q3: Profit jumps over eight-fold on strong margins, revenue growth. Cement manufacturer Star Cement Ltd. reported a sharp rise in third-quarter profit on Friday, February 6, aided by strong revenue growth and improved operating margins.The company’s consolidated net profit jumped 733% to ₹75 crore in the quarter ended December 31, from ₹9 crore a year earlier.Revenue from operations rose 22.4% year-on-year to ₹880 crore, compared with ₹719 crore in the corresponding quarter last year.Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation  nearly doubled, climbing 94.3% to ₹203 crore from ₹104 crore the year-ago period. Operating margin expanded 800 basis points from 15% to 23%.Shares of the company ended ₹211.88 apiece, down 4.79% for the day on the NSE.Also Read: M&M to set up biggest manufacturing unit in Vidarbha with ₹15,000 crore investment

headline: Godrej Properties sees resilient end-user demand, readies strong launch pipeline, says CEO
condensed_text: The company is preparing an active launch pipeline across NCR, Mumbai, Pune and southern markets, backed by a large ready inventory base.Pandey said the company’s strategy going forward will continue to focus on steady launch execution, disciplined capital deployment and sustaining booking momentum, with management confident that consistent operating performance will support growth despite near-term market volatility.Godrej Properties reported a 20% year-on-year rise in net profit to ₹195.2 crore in the October-December quarter of 2025 , compared with ₹162.6 crore a year ago. From launches and sustenance, generally, for the last few quarters, a rule of thumb has been between one-third of our volume to maybe sometimes half of the sales is sustenance, and it's largely emanating because we have a very different structure in Godrej Properties, where we have a dedicated sustenance sales engine, which delivers consistent sales performance, whereas, when we get launches, the launch percentage tends to become slightly better.Q: In that case, how does the launch pipeline look, and how will you fund the upcoming launches?A: Because of the fantastic effort by our business development team, over the last three odd years, we have added about ₹1 lakh crore-plus inventory from 2022-23 . So, a lot of action is packed up, some of which we will see action in this quarter itself, and some of which we will see action continue next financial year, 2026-27 .I'll maybe mention some of the top-of-mind names that come to my mind, which are in this quarter, and their phase activation will continue next year as well, and some launches that can happen next year as well.Also Read: Raymond Realty sees stronger FY26 on back of premium and ultra-luxury launchesSo maybe a bit of a gist — in the north, we will see something very exciting in this quarter itself, which is a project by the name Godrej Arden. We bought recently in Hosur Road last quarter, a 30-acre parcel in a micro market, and this is like a ₹3,500 crore potential booking value that should hit the market next financial year.And then we bought something in Hyderabad recently in an auction, a prime piece of land of five acres, with a potential booking value of ₹4,500 crore, which should hit the market next financial year.In Mumbai, we have a series of launches. So, any developer who was looking at that as the core demand bucket would, of course, see some amount of hit, because that is an easy-come-easy-go market, I would say.But anything which is more end-user driven, which is in the right micro markets of Gurugram, is doing pretty well for us and for our competition and peer group as well.

headline: Tata Steel Q3 Results: Net profit surges 723% to Rs 2,690 crore, revenue up 6%
condensed_text:
Tata Steel Q3 Results: Net profit surges 723% to Rs 2,690 crore, revenue up 6%. Tata Steel reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,689.70 crore for the October-December quarter of FY26 on February 6. This marks a whopping 723 percent YoY rise from the Rs 326.64 crore net profit reported in the same period of last year.
The firm's revenue from operations meanwhile rose more than 6 percent YoY to Rs 56,646.05 crore during the quarter under review.
