headline: No buyback on the cards, but Shree Cement may raise dividend slightly, says HM Bangur
condensed_text: Shree Cement will not go in for a buyback but plans to raise its dividend slightly, Chairman HM Bangur said, adding that the fourth quarter’s numbers should be encouraging.The company's volume growth could touch 10% in the financial year ending March 2027 , higher than the industry average, according to Bangur. Now volumes have started coming, and value, which we had to sacrifice for volume for the last three quarters, that sacrifice part is over," he said.The company recently reported its October–December 2025 quarter results, where net profit rose 37.9% year-on-year to ₹266.7 crore, compared with ₹193.4 crore in the same period last year.Shree Cement currently has a market capitalisation of ₹96,443.84 crore. In terms of percentage, it will be 4 to 5%, but ₹10 to ₹15 is a good price rise.Q: Besides the volume growth being a bit of a disappointment, what's encouraging is that you have managed to bridge that price gap, let's say with UltraTech Cement. So, give and take everything, ₹150 to ₹200 price improvement in quarter four could be par for the course.A: Yes, of course, this will be about ₹150 to ₹200, and ₹1,200 EBITDA per tonne is not far off.Q: I want to ask you about the profitability. So, 4 to 5 million tonne of additional production is not going to matter much.Also Read | Cement, metals, banks: Dharmesh Kant’s playbook for the next 6–9 monthsQ: You believe everyone will prosper?A: Yes, we will also prosper.Q: What do you have to say about UltraTech Cement talking up the South industry?

headline: Man Industries shares rise over 7% after posting strong Q3 as profit jumps 62%, margin expands sharply
condensed_text: Man Industries shares rise over 7% after posting strong Q3 as profit jumps 62%, margin expands sharply. Shares of Man Industries  Ltd surged more than 7% on Monday, February 9, after the company reported a strong set of earnings for the December quarter, with a sharp improvement in profitability and margins, aided by operating leverage and higher execution.For Q3FY26, the company’s consolidated net profit rose 61.8% year-on-year to ₹55 crore from ₹34 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations increased 13.4% YoY to ₹830.4 crore from ₹732 crore.Operating performance improved significantly during the quarter, with EBITDA surging 62% year-on-year to ₹127.7 crore, compared with ₹79 crore in Q3FY25. EBITDA margin expanded to 15.4%, from 10.8% a year ago.Read more: Sterlite Tech surges over 8% on Nuvama Buy call and margin boost from tariff cutsOn a standalone basis, Man Industries reported a net profit of ₹60.9 crore for the quarter, up from ₹37.6 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue from operations stood at ₹803.5 crore, compared with ₹730.8 crore last year, while profit before tax rose to ₹81.7 crore from ₹50.3 crore.The company said its order book stood at approximately ₹4,005 crore as of the date, to be executed over the next 6 to 12 months, providing healthy revenue visibility.Man Industries operates primarily in the steel pipes segment and caters to domestic and international energy and infrastructure projects.Following the Q3 results announcement, shares of Man Industries hit an intraday high of ₹397.40, but the stock has since pared some of its gains and is currently trading 5.04% up at ₹381.65.

headline: Sonata Software bets on healthcare, BFSI, and AI to drive next phase of growth
condensed_text: These businesses, built and scaled over the last few years, now contribute a meaningful share of both revenues and the order pipeline.Management remains optimistic about these segments, citing sustained demand and long-term deal visibility, which continues to offset softness in select client accounts.In the October–December quarter , Sonata Software reported revenue of ₹3,080 crore, profit of ₹104 crore, and margins of 5.21%.These are edited excerpts of the interview.Q: What about the AI led engagements? That's what we're seeing at this point in time.Q: I wanted to understand from a business standpoint, given the sort of conversations around AI, the new developments that are taking place globally as well, for a business like yours, what proportion of your revenue gets impacted by AI in the sense that AI capabilities can do that a lot better than what you are currently offering, or and concomitantly on your cost business, what proportion of AI can reduce your cost? But Sonata business is far more complex on modernisation and regulated industry perspective so we feel at this at this point in time, we are moving forward, embracing the changes that are happening in the industry, helping clients deliver faster, but really keeping a watchful eye on the future as well, because this technology still is evolving at this point in time.Q: In your third quarter numbers, there's a bit of a mixed bag when you look at the sectoral contribution. AI order book is increasing in a very healthy manner, which is much in line with their expectations.Now from a sectoral perspective, clearly we had large client issue in banking and a large client issue in Technology, Media and Telecom , so that's why the sectoral performances look not so good on those two sectors, just because of the two specific clients issue we had.In retail manufacturing, much in line what we have been saying, our tariff have been hitting us. So overall, very bullish about healthcare business, very bullish about where banking businesses, except for one client issue we have, and that's how the quarter came out for us.Q: Just for bookkeeping, if you could tell us a couple of things, the TMT, which is technology, media, telecom, HLS - healthcare and life sciences and RMD - retail, manufacturing, travel and distribution, how much do they contribute in terms of your current revenue, and what is their contribution in terms of your order book?

headline: Kalyan Jewellers, Vaibhav Global, Thangamayil, Senco, PN Gadgil & Goldiam jump up to 15%; here's why
condensed_text: Kalyan Jewellers, Vaibhav Global, Thangamayil, Senco, PN Gadgil & Goldiam jump up to 15%; here's why. Shares of several gems and jewellery companies jumped sharply in Monday’s session, climbing up to 15 per cent, after an interim trade agreement between India and the US boosted investor sentiment. Stocks such as Vaibhav Global Ltd , Goldiam International Ltd, Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd , Thangamayil Jewellery Ltd , PN Gadgil Jewellers Ltd and Senco Gold Ltd witnessed strong buying interest during the session. At last check, shares of Vaibhav Global, Goldiam International and Kalyan Jewellers were up 14.90 per cent, 13.51 per cent and 12.02 per cent, respectively. Thangamayil Jewellery gained 6.08 per cent, while P N Gadgil Jewellers and Senco Gold advanced 5.38 per cent and 4.40 per cent, respectively.

headline: Maruti dispatches record 5.85 lakh vehicles via railways in 2025
condensed_text:
Members of a Maruti Suzuki dealership unload cars from a freight train
-
Maruti Suzuki India on Monday said it dispatched over 5.85 lakh cars through railways last year, an year-on-year growth of 18 per cent over 2024. The auto major said its share of rail mode in outbound logistics has grown exponentially, rising from 5.1 per cent in 2016 to 26 per cent in 2025, significantly reducing carbon emissions, country's oil imports and easing road congestion. "During the year, we strengthened our green logistic efforts through two landmark events– the inauguration of India's largest automobile in-plant railway siding at our Manesar facility, and second was we dispatched vehicles by rail to Kashmir valley through the world's highest railway arch bridge over Chenab river, a first by any automobile manufacturer," Maruti Suzuki India MD and CEO Hisashi Takeuchi said in a statement. The company's mid-term goal is to increase rail-based vehicle dispatches to 35 per cent by FY 2030-31, contributing to India's net-zero ambition by 2070, he added. In CY 2025, rail dispatches from the company's in-plant railway siding at Gujarat and Manesar facility accounted for 53 per cent of its total rail dispatches.

headline: Mahanagar Gas eyes renewable asset purchases, plans Rs 1,300 crore capex in FY27
condensed_text: Mahanagar Gas Ltd (MGL), the supplier of piped gas and CNG across Mumbai and parts of Maharashtra, is exploring acquisitions of renewable energy assets while stepping up the expansion of its compressed natural gas (CNG) network, Managing Director Ashu Shinghal said in an interview. This year, we have added around 3 LNG stations,” Shinghal said, adding that the company will continue to add 3.5 lakh domestic PNG (piped natural gas) connections in the next fiscal. Speaking on the reduction in APM (Administered Price Mechanism) gas allocation, Shinghal said the company’s dependency on APM has effectively decreased, and it is prepared for a further reduction. In April last year, the government cut the allocation of APM gas to city gas distributors by up to 20 percent, replacing it with equal or greater volumes of new well gas (NWG), which is more expensive. Shinghal noted that the reduction in APM is being offset by new well gas, high-pressure, high-temperature (HPHT) gas, spot purchases, Brent-linked contracts, and exchange-based sourcing.

headline: Vodafone Idea shares jump 5% after Kumar Mangalam Birla buys additional stake: Emkay doubles target price
condensed_text:
The shares ofVodafone Idea(Vi) jumped nearly 5 percent on February 9 after data showed that promoter Kumar Mangalam Birla has bought additional stake in the telecom major from the open market. Kumar Managalam Birla buys additional stake in Vodafone Idea:
Kumar Mangalam Birla bought 2.21 crore shares on January 30, and 1.88 crore shares on February 1, according to market data cited by CNBC-TV18. Emkay Global on Vodafone Idea:
Emkay Global upgraded the shares of Vodafone Idea to ‘Add’ from ‘Sell’, and doubled its target price to Rs 12 apiece from Rs 6 apiece earlier. The relief reduces the net present value (NPV) of the burden by 60–80%, easing immediate survival pressure, along with the possibility of further reduction on reassessment of AGR dues. However, Emkay noted that the key risks to its bullish call include inability to increase subscriber market share, significantly increase ARPU with tariff repair and upgrade the subscriber base from 2G to 4G/5G.

headline: Adani Enterprises receives information request from US sanctions watchdog OFAC
condensed_text: Adani Enterprises Limited on Tuesday, February 10, said it has voluntarily engaged with the US Office of Foreign Assets Control  and has received a Request for Information  from the US regulator as part of a civil investigation linked to allegations flagged in a Wall Street Journal article last year.In an exchange filing, Adani Enterprises said the RFI was received through its counsel on February 4, 2026 , following discussions initiated by the company with OFAC in connection with allegations raised in a Wall Street Journal article published on June 2, 2025.The company said the RFI indicates that OFAC is conducting a civil investigation into certain transactions processed through US financial institutions that may have involved, directly or indirectly, Iran or entities subject to US sanctions against Iran. The period under review spans from June 2023 to the present.Adani Enterprises emphasised that the engagement with OFAC is voluntary and part of its effort to cooperate transparently with the US authorities. The company said it will provide the information sought under the RFI and continue to fully cooperate with the regulator.In its disclosure, Adani Enterprises said there are no findings, penalties, sanctions, or restrictions imposed on the company at this stage. LPG formed a “very small and operationally non-material” part of its business, contributing about 1.46% of Adani Enterprises’ revenue and around 0.5% of the Adani Group’s overall revenue in FY25. As a precautionary step, the company said it had already ceased all LPG imports with effect from June 2, 2025.Adani Enterprises clarified that the disclosure is being made in compliance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI Listing Regulations and requested stock exchanges to take the information on record.

headline: Adani Enterprises in talks with US Office of Foreign Assets
condensed_text:
Adani Enterprises in talks with US Office of Foreign Assets. Gautam Adani
STRINGER
Adani Enterprises said on ‌Tuesday ​it is in talks with the US Office of Foreign Assets over allegations from a Wall ​Street Journal report published ⁠in June last year that said billionaire ​Gautam Adani was ⁠trying to get the U.S. President Donald Trump ‌administration to drop bribery ‌charges against him. Adani Enterprises said ‍that it received a Request for Information ‍from the Office of Foreign Assets on February 4. "The communication does not contain any findings ⁠of aberrations or non-compliances," it said. Shares of ​the company fell ⁠as much as 3.5% after the disclosure.

headline: Dixon Technologies hires former Zetwerk electronics head Josh Foulger
condensed_text:
Josh Foulger
Manufacturing unicorn Zetwerk's electronics business head Josh Foulger has resigned from the company and joined a subsidiary of its competitor Dixon Technologies, according to a regulatory filing. "Josh Foulger has been appointed as President- IT Hardware and New Projects in Padget Electronics Private Limited (PEPL), Wholly Owned/ Unlisted Material Subsidiary of Dixon, who shall assume the office with effect from 16th February, 2026," Dixon Technologies said in a regulatory filing. He joins PEPL from Zetwerk, where as CEO of Electronics, he led the division’s rapid expansion into new manufacturing verticals and successfully integrated key acquisitions to drive significant growth,” the filing said 	 Last month Zetwerk chief marketing officer Amrit Raj resigned from the company and joined venture capital firm Jungle Ventures. When contacted, Zetwerk Spokesperson said, "Josh Foulger has been instrumental in shaping Zetwerk Electronics during its early and growth stages. As he has decided to move back to Chennai for personal reasons, we thank him for his contribution and wish him the very best for his future endeavours.” 	 Zetwerk has earmarked Rs 1,000 crore investment for expanding its electronic manufacturing capacity in 2024 after Foulger took over the role.

headline: ACME Solar secures 220 MW solar-battery project in Madhya Pradesh
condensed_text: ACME Solar Holdings Ltd has received a letter of award from Rewa Ultra Mega Solar Limited for a 220 MW solar project with battery energy storage system at Morena Solar Park in Madhya Pradesh. The project forms part of a 440 MW tender floated by RUMSL under tariff-based competitive bidding guidelines, with the e-reverse auction conducted in September 2025. The project requires power supply with a maximum annual capacity utilization factor of 35 per cent, along with four hours of peak supply at 95 percent annual availability. ACME Solar currently operates a portfolio of 8,071 MW across solar, wind, storage and hybrid solutions, with 2,966 MW operational contracted capacity and 5,105 MW under construction. The shares of ACME Solar Holdings Ltd were trading at ₹233.4 up by ₹75.44 or 2.39 per cent on the NSE in the early trade today.

headline: Lupin clears patent hurdle with Astellas Pharma, keeps Mirabegron sales in US
condensed_text:
Lupin said on Tuesday it agreed ‌to a $90 million settlement ​with Japan's
Astellas Pharma in a patent dispute over the bladder
disorder drug Mirabegron, a move that allows it to continue
selling the product in the United States. Under the agreement, Lupin ​and its U.S. unit will pay
Astellas ⁠a $75 million upfront payment and per-unit licensing
fees on Mirabegron sales through September 2027, the ​company
said in ⁠an exchange filing. In a separate statement, the Japanese drugmaker said the
settlement concludes its litigation with Lupin and ‌added that it
is reviewing the ‌potential financial impact for the fiscal year
ending March 31, 2026. Lupin ‍had previously disclosed the patent dispute with
Astellas last April over its generic ‍version of Myrbetriq,
Astellas' overactive bladder drug, after a U.S. court ruling
raised the risk that generic versions could be withdrawn from
the market. Citi analysts said the settlement removes legal uncertainty
around Lupin's Mirabegron sales in the U.S. ⁠and could delay the
entry of other generic rivals, potentially providing ​Lupin and
Zydus Lifesciences, another drugmaker involved in ⁠the
litigation, with a period of limited competition.
Sector: NIFTY HEALTHCARE INDEX, NIFTY MIDSMALL HEALTHCARE, NIFTY PHARMA, NIFTY500 HEALTHCARE

headline: Why TCS, CUB, Marico, GRSE, Shree Refrigerations, HAL, Ceigall, Godrej Agrovet, Axiscades, Anant Raj, UVS Hospitality to remain active in today’s trade
condensed_text: Why TCS, CUB, Marico, GRSE, Shree Refrigerations, HAL, Ceigall, Godrej Agrovet, Axiscades, Anant Raj, UVS Hospitality to remain active in today’s trade. TCS partners with Redzone to modernise mid-market manufacturing, City Union Bank names R Vijay Anandh as MD, Marico SEA buys Skinetiq, while GRSE, Shree Refrigerations, Ceigall, Axiscades, and Submer announce key strategic wins. Marico South East Asia Corporation (MSEA), a wholly owned subsidiary of Marico Ltd , has announced that its subsidiary has entered into an agreement to acquire a majority stake in a Vietnam-based skin care company, Skinetiq, according to an exchange filing. Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers (GRSE) Ltd and Hindustan Shipyard Limited (HSL) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to form a consortium aimed at undertaking a large-scale, strategically significant national shipbuilding programme. Axiscades Technologies, a chip-to-product company and a pioneer in Aerospace, Defence, Electronics, Semiconductor, and Artificial Intelligence (ESAI), headquartered in Bangalore, India, has announced a new win for its subsidiary, Mistral Solutions, in the Defence division.

headline: Q3 results impact: Amber Enterprises stock up 6% as net loss narrows QoQ; Bata India gains 4.5%, Ramco Cements down 3%
condensed_text:
Q3 results impact: Amber Enterprises stock up 6% as net loss narrows QoQ; Bata India gains 4.5%, Ramco Cements down 3%. Amber Enterprises
Shares of Amber Enterprises Ltd rose 6% on February 10 after the company reported a net loss for the second consecutive quarter but it narrowed sequentially. Bata India
Shares of Bata India rose 4.5% to Rs 926.25 apiece on February 10 as the footwear chain owner posted 13% rise in Q3 profit, helped by festive demand and consumption tax cut and revenue was up 3%. Ramco Cements
Ramco Cements slips after missing estimates for quarterly core profit
Shares of Ramco Cements declined 3% to Rs 1,172 apiece on February 10 as the South India-focussed cement maker posted a rise in third-quarter profit but fell short of volume growth expectations
Brokerages Jefferies, Motilal Oswal Financial Services and Emkay said the company's EBITDA missed estimates due to double whammy of weak volumes and weak pricing in its core markets of Southern and Eastern India
Intense competition hurt pricing, said Jefferies while giving "hold" rating. The brokerage also noted the expansion of non-cement segments like construction chemicals worth monitoring for revenue diversification as cement competition intensifies
So far in 2026, the stock rose 10%.

headline: Poly Medicure says margins dip was one-off, growth to improve in the second half
condensed_text: Delhi-based medical device maker Poly Medicure expects growth to be stronger in the second half compared to the first, with the company likely to end the year with an overall growth of around 20%.Himanshu Baid, Managing Director of Poly Medicure said the initial slowdown was largely due to softness in overseas markets, but that trend has started to reverse, providing better visibility on revenues going ahead.On the domestic side, the company is tracking overall growth of about 21–22%, led by the private segment, which is growing at a faster pace of around 25%.He said the margin impact during the third quarter was a one-off, mainly due to labour code changes and acquisition-related costs. He expects margins to improve from here as these exceptional costs fall away and the newly acquired subsidiaries scale up and improve their profitability.Baid remains optimistic about the next financial year, with subsidiaries expected to contribute more meaningfully and export markets in Europe and the US reopening after earlier delays.Europe is already showing signs of improvement, and export growth of 12–15% is currently visible, with clearer guidance expected by the end of the fourth quarter.In October-December quarter , Poly Medicure reported a revenue of ₹493 crore, profit of ₹70 crore and margins of 23%.These are edited excerpts of the interview.Q: This year is going to be obviously a lower than estimated growth. This was a one-off quarter on a consolidated basis, the net margin level, but in terms of gross margins, we have improved by actually 200-300 basis points in the current quarter.Q: Margin should get back to 25-27% and on the topline you maintain the 15 to 16% growth guidance?A: If you see a current quarter, we have done close to 15-16% growth from the previous quarter, and this quarter also will see a similar number. Next year also, we should see a similar growth unless, until there is a big change in the duty structure, or there is something intervention by the government, we don't see moving back to that 35-40% number.Q: Have you reached out to the government, for some sort of protection against dumping by China on renal products?A: We have reached out and we are working on that. Hopefully government is working on it and we will see something in next few months coming up.Q: On this India US trade deal for medtech products, the tariff has been cut from 15 to 18% if you could give perspective on the industry, what percentage is India's exports to the US from an industry point of view, how would it compare with, say, you know, from a country like China?

headline: Adani Enterprises confirms talks with US sanctions office over Wall Street Journal report
condensed_text: Adani Enterprises has disclosed that it has voluntarily initiated engagement with the US Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) in connection with allegations referenced in a Wall Street Journal article published on June 2, 2025. In a regulatory filing made under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, the company said it began discussions with OFAC proactively and in a cooperative and transparent manner. As part of this engagement, Adani Enterprises, through its legal counsel, received a formal Request for Information (RFI) from OFAC dated February 4, 2026 (India time) and February 3, 2026 (US time). The disclosure follows allegations highlighted in the June 2025 Wall Street Journal report, which had claimed thatGautam Adaniwas seeking intervention from officials in the administration of then US President Donald Trump to have foreign bribery charges dropped. Adani Group had denied the allegations at the time, stating that it had not engaged in sanctions evasion or trade involving Iranian-origin LPG and that it was not aware of any investigation by US authorities on the matter.

headline: Citi says $90-mn Lupin-Astellas Pharma settlement may delay rival generic launches
condensed_text: Citi Research said Lupin's $90-million patent settlement with Astellas Pharma may prevent other generic drugmakers from launching generic Mirabegron for an extended period, potentially giving Lupin and Zydus Lifesciences about 12–18 months of limited competition. Lupin said on Tuesday it agreed to a $90-million settlement with Japan's Astellas Pharma in a patent dispute over the bladder disorder drug Mirabegron, a move that allows it to continue selling the product in the United States. Under the agreement, Lupin and its US unit will pay Astellas a $75 million upfront payment and per-unit licensing fees on Mirabegron sales through September 2027, the company said in an exchange filing. In a separate statement, the Japanese drugmaker said the settlement concludes its litigation with Lupin and added that it is reviewing the potential financial impact for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026. Lupin had previously disclosed the patent dispute with Astellas last April over its generic version of Myrbetriq, Astellas' overactive bladder drug, after a U.S. court ruling raised the risk that generic versions could be withdrawn from the market.
Sector: NIFTY HEALTHCARE INDEX, NIFTY MIDSMALL HEALTHCARE, NIFTY PHARMA, NIFTY500 HEALTHCARE

headline: Destabilised Bangladesh, a near-term risk for Arvind but long-term opportunity for India: Punit Lalbhai
condensed_text:
Punit Lalbhai, Vice Chairman, Arvind Ltd
Arvind Website
A destabilised Bangladesh could hurt Gujarat-based textile manufacturer Arvind Ltd in the short term but also create an opening for India’s apparel ambitions, Vice Chairman Punit Lalbhai said. And I don’t want Bangladesh to suffer,” Lalbhai said, noting that Bangladesh remains a key end market for the company’s fabric business and that Arvind has a “high dependency” on India’s eastern neighbour. “It could be an opportunity on the yarn side because yarn prices will go down, but that’s not good for India because we have a lot of yarn capacity that has come up. “We are having conversations with customers, and we are reallocating a lot of internal marketing and sales resources to focus on these geographies so that we can build the pipeline before the implementation of the duty-free tariff,” Lalbhai said. “If I have $1 to invest, I will invest it in garmenting because garmenting is easier to sell and customers increasingly want a vertical offering rather than just fabric.

headline: Tata Steel shares rise 7% in two days after strong Q3. Should investors buy now?
condensed_text: Shares of one of India’s leading steel manufacturers, Tata Steel , rose as much as 4.5% to their day’s high of Rs 911 on the BSE on Tuesday, extending gains for a second session in a row following the company’s third quarter earnings. In India, spreads are likely to expand as a Rs 3,500 per tonne recovery in HRC spot prices could lift blended NSRs by around Rs 2,300 per tonne QoQ, factoring in product mix and contracts. Consolidated volumes are projected to rise 10% YoY to around 9.2 MT in Q4FY26F, leading to an estimated sequential increase of about Rs 400 per tonne in consolidated EBITDA to roughly Rs 10,400 per tonne. Elara Capital has reiterated its Accumulate rating on Tata Steel and raised its target price to Rs 215 from Rs 187, citing the recent uptick in steel prices since mid-December and the imposition of safeguard duties on imports, which are expected to support near-term earnings growth. Elara noted that the anticipated reduction in funding overhang from domestic operations toward EU businesses has led it to revise the valuation multiple for domestic operations to 6.5x EV/EBITDA from 6.0x earlier, while retaining a 5.0x multiple for other businesses.

headline: US OFAC probing past transactions possibly linked to Iran: Adani Enterprises
condensed_text: Adani Enterprises Ltd on Tuesday said the United States Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) is conducting a civil investigation into certain of the company’s past transactions processed through US financial institutions, which may have involved --- directly or indirectly --- Iran or entities subject to US sanctions. In a regulatory filing, the company said it received a Request for Information (RFI) from OFAC through its legal counsel on February 4 (India time). “In the RFI, OFAC has also indicated that it is conducting a civil investigation of the Company’s transactions processed through U.S. financial institutions that may have involved, directly or indirectly, Iran or interests of persons subject to U.S. sanctions against Iran,” the company stated in its filing. It also stated that Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) --- which seems to be the subject of the inquiry ---constituted a non-material portion of revenues, accounting for 1.46 percent of Adani Enterprises’ revenue and 0.5 percent of the Adani Group’s overall revenue in FY25. “As a matter of abundant caution and in furtherance of its cooperation efforts, the Company has ceased all LPG imports with effect from June 2, 2025,” the filing said.

headline: Buy Krishna Institute of Medical Sciences; target of Rs 810: Prabhudas Lilladher
condensed_text:
Buy Krishna Institute of Medical Sciences; target of Rs 810: Prabhudas Lilladher. Prabhudas Lilladher's research report onKrishna Institute of Medical Sciences
Krishna Institute of Medical Sciences (KIMS) reported EBITDA growth of 6% YoY, led by reducing losses from new greenfield units and improved operating leverage at mature clusters. headline: Tracxn Tech hits 20% upper circuit after Mukul Agrawal purchases 20 lakh shares for Rs 6.6 crore
condensed_text: Tracxn Technologies share price hit the 20 percent upper circuit in early trade on Tuesday a day after ace investor Mukul Mahavir Agrawal bought 20 lakh shares of the company for Rs 6.6 crore through a bulk deal. The stock opened with a gap-up gain of 6.46 percent and advanced to an intraday high of Rs 40.68 per share on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a 20 percent jump, which is also its upper circuit limit. The sharp rise came after Agrawal purchased 20,00,000 shares at Rs 33 per share on Monday, amounting to a total investment of Rs 6.6 crore, as per bulk deal data. According to BSE shareholding data, Agrawal held 20 lakh shares, or a 1.88 percent stake, in the company as of December 31, 2025. Bengaluru-based Tracxn Technologies operates on a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) model and provides market intelligence on private companies.

headline: Tata Motors-Stellantis sign MoU for future collaboration as JV turns 20
condensed_text: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles and global automotive major Stellantis on February 10, signed a memorandum of understanding to explore new opportunities for collaboration across manufacturing, engineering and supply chain operations, both in India and overseas. In a joint release, Grégoire Olivier, Chief Operating Officer of Stellantis Asia Pacific, said the joint venture exemplifies the value of long-term partnerships. As we commemorate this milestone, we remain focused on evolving the partnership to support future-ready manufacturing, innovation, and sustainable growth in the region,” he said. “Our partnership with Stellantis through FIAPL reflects the strength of a long-standing collaboration built on trust, shared values and a common vision. Industry observers see the renewed collaboration as timely, as automakers increasingly seek strategic alliances to strengthen supply chains, accelerate innovation and enhance competitiveness in a rapidly changing global automotive landscape.

headline: Delivery tech stocks surge: Eternal shares rise 6% to 12-week high, Swiggy up 5%; here’s why
condensed_text:
Eternalshares jumped more than 6 percent to trade at Rs 307.45 apiece on Tuesday, the highest level seen by the stock since November 21. Eternal’s new AI tool:
Zomato on Monday said it has launched a dedicated AI-powered hotline (89200 89200) to simplify the onboarding process for delivery partners, Business Standard reported. According to a company statement quoted by the site, “the call initiates an AI-enabled WhatsApp journey where onboarding and background verification unfold in minutes”. Domestic MFs hike holdings in new age companies, says report:
Additionally, a report by Economic Times claimed that domestic mutual funds held shares worth around Rs 1.77 lakh crore in around 12 new-age companies at the end of 2025. Eternal, which is part of the benchmark Nifty 50 index, accounted for more than 40 percent of total mutual fund holdings in new-age companies, the report said, adding that these funds were major buyers in Swiggy’s Ra 10,000-crore share sale in December last year.

headline: I-PAC raids: SC adjourns to Feb 18 ED's plea against 'interference' by Mamata Banerjee
condensed_text: I-PAC raids: SC adjourns to Feb 18 ED's plea against 'interference' by Mamata Banerjee. The Supreme Court on Tuesday adjourned to February 18 the hearing on a plea moved by the ED alleging obstruction by the West Bengal government, including by Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, in its search operation at the I-PAC office and the premises of its director in connection with an alleged coal pilferage scam.A bench of Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and Sandeep Mehta deferred the matter after it was informed that senior advocate Kapil Sibal was unwell.Solicitor General Tushar Mehta agreed to the adjournment.The top court on January 15 said the West Bengal chief minister’s alleged "obstruction" in ED’s probe is "very serious" and agreed to examine if a state’s law-enforcing agencies can interfere with any central agency’s probe into any serious offence as it stayed FIRs against the agency’s officials who raided political consultancy I-PAC on January 8.The top court, while staying the FIRs filed in West Bengal against ED officials, also directed the state police to protect the CCTV footage of the raids.It had issued notices to Banerjee, the West Bengal government, DGP Rajeev Kumar and top cops on the ED’s petitions seeking a CBI probe against them for allegedly obstructing raids at I-PAC premises.The ED has also alleged that Banerjee entered the raid sites and took away ”key” evidence, including physical documents and electronic devices, from the premises of I-PAC and obstructed and interfered with the investigation in the case.The ED has further claimed in its plea that the chief minister’s presence at the search site and the alleged removal of documents had an intimidating effect on officers and seriously compromised the federal probe agency’s ability to discharge its statutory functions independently.The ED’s plea in the apex court follows events from January 8, when the agency conducted searches on the premises of I-PAC and its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata as part of a money-laundering probe into the alleged multi-crore-rupee coal-pilferage scam.During the search operation, Banerjee reached the I-PAC office along with senior TMC leaders, confronted the ED officials and allegedly took away documents from the premises. The chief minister has accused the central agency of overreach.The West Bengal Police has also registered an FIR against ED officers.The TMC has denied the ED’s allegation of obstruction.It has further alleged that the ED action against I-PAC, the election consultant of the party, was aimed at accessing confidential election-strategy material.The party has maintained that I-PAC functions as its election strategist and that the ED’s action was intended to disrupt its electoral preparations rather than pursuing any bona fide investigation in the case.Assembly polls are due in West Bengal in a few months.

headline: Edelweiss Financial Services shares gain 7% post positive Q3 results, revenue rises to ₹4,404 crore
condensed_text: Edelweiss Financial Services shares gain 7% post positive Q3 results, revenue rises to ₹4,404 crore. Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services Ltd. surged over 3% after it reported its third quarter earnings on Tuesday, February 10.The company's net profit increased to 264 crore from ₹124.3 crore in the previous year.Its revenue surged to ₹4,404.4 crore from ₹1,898 crore in the year-ago period.Edelweiss said its alternative asset management witnessed a 33% increase fee-paying assets under management  at ₹41,920 crore.Its mutual fund business equity AUM surged 33% as well to ₹83,000 crore and its SIP book crossed the ₹500 crore-mark after increasing 55% from the previous year.It disbursed MSME loans of ₹298 crore in the third quarter, up 5.7 times from the previous year, while its wholesale book reduced 34% to ₹2,400 crore.The company's disbursements in housing finance increased 36% to ₹559 crore, while its AUM increased 21% to ₹4,804 crore.The gross written premium for general insurance increased 47% to ₹404 crore in the December quarter. Edelweiss said it achieved record quarterly policy issuance of 2.54 lakh.In life insurance, the gross premium increased by 15% to ₹514 crore from the previous year and AUM grew by 17% to ₹10,486 crore."We have filed Edelweiss Alternative Asset Advisors'  DRHP for IPO in January and are on track for the listing, marking the first step towards building EAAA as a standalone institutionalised platform," Rashesh Shah, the chairman of Edelweiss Financial Services, said.Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services Ltd. were up 7.2% at ₹119.2 apiece around 1.25 pm on Tuesday. The stock has gained 13.3% in the past month and 27% in the last six months.Also Read: Sterlite Tech shares extend gains, hit fresh 52-week high; Stock surges 70% in a month

headline: Small-cap rally durable with more upside on fundamentals, liquidity: Bajaj Finserv AMC
condensed_text: The recent rebound in small-cap stocks is durable and has much more upside, supported by fundamentals and fresh liquidity, says Nimesh Chandan, Chief Investment Officer at Bajaj Finserv AMC.Explaining why he believes the recovery is sustainable after the recent bounce, Chandan said, “I think it is durable because it is backed by fundamentals. It was the sentiment, which was under pressure, and with the recent news of trade deals, that sentiment has recovered, and with the kind of deal that we've got with the US, I think there's more to come. So, there is much more to come.”Putting recent earnings performance into perspective, Chandan highlighted the sharp outperformance of small caps but cautioned on sustainability, saying, “This quarter, the small caps have delivered much better earnings growth… So large caps have so far given about 12% kind of profit growth. However, you should also look at the basis of how they were last year.”Outlining why the broader business environment in India is improving, he said, “Overall, we are in a better position compared to the last 12 months, because we are seeing the pickup on the consumption side. The cost of capital has come down over the last 12 months, and that is also helping businesses… if your cost of capital is coming down, your domestic market is picking up, and you have prospects in the export market, I think there isa  lot to play with.”Also Read: Global markets are fragile; be cautious with fresh investments, warns Richard HarrisOn whether the sharp earnings growth in small caps can continue, Chandan said sentiment is improving, but growth will normalise, adding, “The sentiment is getting better… from whatever interactions we've had with companies, sentiment is getting better… I don't think this 30% kind of growth can continue, but there is a lot to play within this small cap space now, where quality businesses are seeing some revival in growth and valuations are attractive because the entire category went through a correction in the last few months.”Explaining where his fund is finding opportunities, Chandan said, “We've seen selectively now within different pockets… materials, we are seeing good amount of action in cement, metals and even some of the chemicals companies… within consumer discretionary, now, we are seeing an improvement in demand… within industrial… capital goods, even within power, we are seeing many companies giving good numbers… except for maybe the IT sector, which is again, a top down kind of a negative view that we have.”Detailing how he is positioned for the economic upcycle, he said, “If you see in our portfolio, what we have done is we have added cement across the space… whether it is large cap… and then there are a couple of good mid cap companies… and a couple of small caps there… Metals, again, for ferrous and nonferrous, there are clear leaders in the space, and we go with the largest companies in this area… We have added more weightage among BFSI to private banks… So these three sectors, if you see industrials, materials and financials, these are the sectors you play with the up move or the economic upcycle.”Also Read: HDFC Life, SBI Life and Max Financial now on similar footing, Bernstein cautious on PB FintechOn the information technology sector, Chandan said weak sentiment is likely to persist, even though a sharp fall is unlikely, stating, “If sentimental negative will carry for some time… every few months probably you will see… because every company is working towards productivity gains… I think this hangover will continue for some time, and it will weigh on the valuations… But the cash flows, the return on capital ratios, the dividend payments or even buybacks… may not lead to a severe fall in the IT sector.
Sector: NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES 25/50, NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES EX-BANK
Index: NIFTY 100, NIFTY 200, NIFTY 50, NIFTY 500, NIFTY FINANCIAL SERVICES

headline: Stellantis, Tata Motors sign MoU to deepen collaboration as JV marks 20 years
condensed_text:
REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes/File Photo
GONZALO FUENTES
Global auto major Stellantis and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles on Monday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to explore deeper collaboration across manufacturing, engineering and supply chains, marking 20 years of their joint venture in India. The partnership, operated through Fiat India Automobiles Private Limited (FIAPL), has produced more than 1.37 million vehicles since its inception and currently manufactures around 2,22,000 vehicles annually. Under the MoU, the two companies will evaluate opportunities for collaboration both in India and overseas, leveraging Stellantis’ global manufacturing and technology expertise and Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles’ local market capabilities. “FIAPL stands as a testament to what two strong organisations can achieve together,” said Grégoire Olivier, Chief Operating Officer, Stellantis Asia Pacific, adding that the focus going forward would be on future-ready manufacturing, innovation and sustainable growth in the region. Shailesh Chandra, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles, said the partnership was built on trust and shared values, and that the company looked forward to deepening ties with Stellantis in the years ahead.

headline: Billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla raises Vodafone Idea stake after purchasing 4 crore shares from open market
condensed_text: Billionaire industrialist and Vodafone Idea promoter Kumar Mangalam Birla has raised his stake in the telecom operator through open market transactions over the past week, acquiring a total of 4.09 crore shares between January 30 and February 1. Of the total, around 2.21 crore shares were bought on January 30 at an average price of Rs 10.95 (discount of 5.5% from the last close) per share, while an additional 1.88 crore shares were purchased on February 1 at an average price of Rs 11.13 (3.8% discount) apiece. As of December 2025, Birla held approximately 1.94 crore shares in Vodafone Idea, representing a 0.02% stake, while the promoter group collectively owned 25.5% of the telecom company. Vodafone Idea Q3 snapshot The telecom operator reported a net loss of Rs 5,286 crore for Q3, narrowing from a loss of Rs 5,524 crore in the previous quarter. Annual payments of Rs 124 crore are scheduled between FY26 and FY31, followed by Rs 100 crore annually from FY32 to FY35, with the remaining balance to be paid in six equal installments between FY36 and FY41.

headline: Chalet Hotels sees strong 2-3 year growth run as demand-supply gap lifts earnings
condensed_text: Chalet Hotels, part of the K Raheja Corp group, expects the hospitality sector to stay on a firm footing over the next couple of years, helped by strong travel demand and a persistent demand-supply gap.Shwetank Singh, MD & CEO of Chalet Hotels highlighted that although January was relatively muted, demand picked up meaningfully in February and has stayed steady into March, keeping the company confident about a solid close to the financial year.Singh expects the next two to three years to remain favourable for the hospitality industry, with revenue per available room growth likely to stay in double digits, led more by rising average room rates than occupancy gains.Chalet Hotels is strengthening its portfolio through the Athiva brand, while maintaining balance-sheet comfort with stable debt levels and adequate headroom to fund future expansions and acquisitions.In October-December quarter , Chalet Hotels reported revenues of ₹581, profit after tax of ₹124 crore and margins of 45.6%.These are edited excerpts of the interview.Q: What does your target stand at in terms of revenue, and what is the expectation now that we should have for FY27?A: Unfortunately, it's hard for me to give you forward numbers, but it has been an excellent growth for us. If I look at quarter three numbers at a consolidated level, we grew revenue by about 27%, with EBITDA growing by 29% but ex-residential, which is a one-off we normally see our business ex-residential, and that's also grown 23% on revenue and 24% on EBITDA, quarter-on-quarter.The other good thing is, on a nine-month consolidated basis, we have grown 24% on revenue to about ₹15,103 odd crores, and about ₹677, crores at EBITDA level, for 28% year-on-year growth. Would that be a fair estimate?A: It's interesting you say that because that if you see pan India numbers for the calendar year, and not talking financial year, because most operators report calendar year numbers, we have come in at about 67% occupancy so far pan India at about ₹8,800 average daily rate , and that brings the revenue per available room  to say ₹5,500 and that growth has been quite steady and very encouraging. Some of the stuff that came through this time is also very heartening, because the approach of the government, clearly, is to improve the overall tourism infrastructure, and not just focus on one part of tourism, and that's one of the things that has been lacking in the country.The experience of tourists who have to be seen holistically and not just one segment of their holiday, so it's great that the government is looking at it that way. So, as a company, we have not moved away from third party operations, Athiva is one of the offerings, and yes, we will favour it, but we will continue to assess it in a dispassionate manner.Finally, just to finish up on debt, our debt remains at about ₹2,000 odd crores that has not moved dramatically from the last time we spoke, and we are very comfortable, sort of placed, both from an internal accrual perspective and headroom to take more debt to sort of fund all our future expansions and acquisitions as they come.Live stock market updates—follow our blog

headline: Panama Petrochem Q3 profit slips 6% YoY
condensed_text: Panama Petrochem reported a muted performance in the December quarter, with profitability coming under pressure.The company’s net profit declined 5.6% year-on-year to ₹46 crore in Q3, compared with ₹49 crore in the same quarter last year. The fall in bottom line was driven by margin contraction amid a higher cost base.Revenue from operations rose 6.5% YoY to ₹775 crore, up from ₹728 crore a year ago, supported by stable demand across product segments and continued execution momentum during the quarter.EBITDA declined 3.8% YoY to ₹60.6 crore, compared with ₹61 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Inventory movement remained favourable, with a reduction of ₹15.9 crore during the quarter.Employee benefit expenses were ₹9.1 crore, finance costs stood at ₹2.4 crore, and depreciation and amortisation expense was ₹3.4 crore. Other expenses for the quarter were ₹49.7 crore.Overall, the quarter reflected stable topline growth but pressure on margins, as higher costs offset revenue gains, keeping profitability under check despite healthy operational activity.Panama Petrochem Ltd  is an Indian specialty‑petrochemical manufacturer that makes and sells chemicals derived from crude‑oil/ base‑oil feedstock to industrial customers. The company runs plants in India and the UAE and exports to the Middle East, Africa, and other regions.For the nine months ended December, Panama Petrochem’s revenue from operations grew 6.9% YoY to ₹2,241.5 crore, compared with ₹2,097.7 crore a year ago.

headline: UltraTech Cement, Dalmia Bharat & JK Cements: Axis Direct shares top conviction stock picks
condensed_text: In its sector note, the domestic brokerage said, "We remain positive as long-term demand drivers are intact and expect cement demand to grow at a CAGR of 7%-8% over FY24-27E. For UltraTech Cement, Axis Direct said, "With expanded capacity and scale, the company is positioned to strengthen its market leadership, targeting a market share increase from 25 per cent to 28 per cent. The brokerage mentioned that the company has commenced commercial production at its 3.6 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) clinker unit in Umrangso, Assam, calling it a key milestone. "In parallel, Dalmia is actively pursuing cost-saving initiatives, targeting a reduction of Rs 150–200/tonne over the next two years through enhanced operational efficiency and process optimisation," Axis's note added. On JK Cement, Axis said, "The company delivered a positive operating performance during the quarter, supported by volume growth and lower cost, leading to a 4% QoQ improvement in EBITDA per tonne to Rs 929."

headline: Exclusive: Embassy REIT bullish on India-US deal, lines up Rs 4,000-cr capex plan
condensed_text:
Even as the India–US and India–EU trade deals are expected to accelerate Global Capability Centre (GCC) expansion in the country, Embassy Office Parks REIT (Real Estate Investment Trust) is doubling down on organic growth, chief executive Amit Shetty said. “India currently has about 1,900 GCCs, which will grow to around 2,400–2,500 by 2030, employing nearly 2.5 million people,” he said, adding that mid-tier US firms and companies from Europe, Australia and Asia-Pacific are increasingly setting up operations in India. “With India producing about 2.5 million STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) graduates annually and having the world’s largest pool of data scientists and the second-largest AI talent base, trade pacts with the US and EU will be positive for real estate and the economy,” Shetty said. Rs 4,000-crore organic development pipeline
“We are developing 7.6 million square feet (msf) organically, within our portfolio, at a capex spend of about Rs 4,000 crore. Shettly said that Embassy REIT has also signed a share purchase agreement to acquire Embassy Pinehurst, a 300,000 square feet office building located within Embassy Golf Links, one of Bengaluru’s strongest office micro-markets.

headline: Edelweiss rises 9% as Carlyle to invest Rs 2,100 crore for 45% stake in firm's unit, Q3 net profit more than doubles
condensed_text:
Shares of Edelweiss Financial Services rose 9% on February 10 as the firm's net profit more than doubled in December quarter and the firm announced that US- based Asset manager Carlyle will acquire a 45% stake in the company's unit Nido Home Finance for Rs 2,100 crore. With a robust presence across the country, Nido operates a large network of branches, serving over 800 talukas (sub-districts) in India, and currently manages an AUM of Rs 4,804 crore (approximately $530 million)," said Edelweiss in a stock exchange filing. "For Carlyle, the investment reflects its continued commitment to supporting India’s high growth housing finance sector and builds on its more than two decades of deep expertise, operating capabilities and strong track record investing in India’s financial services sector, including in housing finance businesses such as PNB Housing Finance Limited (PNBHF) and Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC)," added Edelweiss. I have deep respect for the financial services franchise that Carlyle has built over many years in India and am very excited that they will be partners to help Nido in its next stage of scale-up.”
Sunil Kaul, Partner and Asia Financial Services Sector Lead, Carlyle, said: “We are thrilled to partner with Edelweiss to support the next phase of Nido’s growth journey. Additionally, we look forward to leveraging our operational experience to support Nido in strengthening its governance and risk management frameworks for longterm sustainable growth and success.”
Edelweiss also said its alternative asset management witnessed a 33% increase fee-paying assets under management (FPAUM) at Rs 41,920 crore in the December quarter.

headline: Jubilant Foodworks shares rise 2.02% in Tuesday's trading session
condensed_text:
The revenue for the quarter-ending September 2025 stood at Rs 2,340.15 Crore, up from Rs 2,260.86 Crore in June 2025, Rs 2,103.18 Crore in March 2025, Rs 2,150.76 Crore in December 2024, and Rs 1,954.72 Crore in September 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending September 2025 was Rs 192.23 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 91.14 Crore in June 2025, Rs 48.69 Crore in March 2025, Rs 43.54 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 68.79 Crore in September 2024. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) has also increased, with the EPS for the quarter-ending September 2025 at Rs 1.61, up from Rs 1.43 in June 2025, Rs 0.73 in March 2025, Rs 0.65 in December 2024, and Rs 0.97 in September 2024. In 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 8,141.73 Crore, compared to Rs 5,654.09 Crore in 2024, Rs 5,158.25 Crore in 2023, Rs 4,396.12 Crore in 2022, and Rs 3,311.87 Crore in 2021. Corporate Actions:
Jubilant Foodworks has announced several corporate actions, including disclosures under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, and intimation of analyst/investor meets for Q3FY26 and 9MFY26 financial results.

headline: Q3 results impact: Samvardhana Motherson shares jump 5%; Sansera Engg, Wakefit rally up to 12%
condensed_text:
Samvardhana Motherson shares jumped more than 5 percent to a new record high of Rs 130.97 apiece on Tuesday, while newly-listed shares of Wakefit Innovations surged nearly 10 percent to hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 204 apiece. Samvardhana Motherson Q3 Results:
Samvardhana Mothersonreported a consolidated net profit of Rs 1,024 crore for Q3 FY26, marking a 16.5 percent year-on-year (YoY) increase from the Rs 879 crore net profit reported in Q3 FY25. Wakefit Innovations Q3 Results:
Wakefit Innovationsswinged to black, reporting a net profit of Rs 31.86 crore for Q3 FY26, as against a net loss of Rs 2.41 crore in the same period last year. Sansera Engineering Q3 Results:
Sansera Engineeringreported a consolidated net profit of Rs 68.71 crore for Q3 FY26, marking a 23 percent YoY increase from the Rs 55.67 crore net profit reported in Q3 FY25. “I am thrilled to update you that Sansera has set a new quarterly performance benchmark for revenue and EBITDA at INR 9,077 Mn and EBITDA of INR 1,639 Mn (18.1% margin), respectively.

headline: Berger Paints India share price falls 2.06%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
condensed_text: Shares ofBerger Paints Indiadeclined 2.06% to Rs 457.55 in Tuesday's trading session, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Revenue for the quarter-ending September 2025 was Rs 2,827.49 Crore, while the quarter-ending June 2025 saw revenue of Rs 3,200.76 Crore. Revenue in 2023 was Rs 10,567.84 Crore, while in 2022 it was Rs 8,761.78 Crore, and in 2021 it stood at Rs 6,817.59 Crore. The net profit in 2023 was Rs 873.57 Crore, while in 2022 it was Rs 829.09 Crore, and in 2021 it was Rs 725.33 Crore. Berger Paints has also issued bonus shares, with the latest bonus ratio of 1:5 announced on August 9, 2023, with an ex-bonus date of September 22, 2023.

headline: Samvardhana Motherson Q3 results: Profit jumps 9% YoY
condensed_text: Samvardhana Motherson Q3 results: Auto equipment manufacturer Samvardhana Motherson International on Tuesday, February 10, reported a 9% year-on-year (YoY) rise in its consolidated profit to ₹ 1,072.27 crore for the December quarter of the current financial year (Q3FY26). Total consolidated revenue from operations for the quarter rose 13.5% YoY to ₹ 31,409.39 crore from ₹ 27,665.92 crore in Q3FY25. Customer trust, combined with our diverse capabilities, traction across automotive and non-automotive businesses, and the dedication of our global teams, has resulted in our highest-ever quarterly revenues," said Vivek Chaand Sehgal, Chairman, Motherson. We are confident that with the support of our customers and dedication of our teams, we will continue to deliver long-term value to our stakeholders,” said Sehgal. Net leverage ratio at 1.1 times: The company said it maintained leverage despite continued investments for growth and inflated working capital –concerted efforts are being made for deleveraging.

headline: Conviction buys: UltraTech, Dalmia Bharat and JK Cement offer up to 14% returns. Axis Direct explains why
condensed_text: UltraTech Cement | Upside: 8% With 10% returns in the past 3 months, UltraTech Cement shares have outperformed Nifty (2%). The company will benefit from the growing market share of large cement companies, increasing from 55% to 65%-70% by FY27-28. Dalmia Bharat | Upside: 14% With 9% gains in the past three months, Dalmia Bharat is another conviction buy for this brokerage in the cement sector. Post expansion, Central India will account for 40% of JK Cement’s grey capacity, while entry into the Eastern region strengthens its long-term growth footprint. Supported by rising infrastructure-led demand, the company is well placed to capture higher cement consumption, underpinning a 14% revenue CAGR over FY25–FY28E.
